original: Gopathabrāhmaṇa /🔽Pūrvabhāga /
analyzed: gopathabrāhmaṇa  pūrvabhāga
translated: The Brāhmaṇa of the Cow's Foot.🔽The first part.

original: Prathamaḥ prapāṭhakaḥ
analyzed: prathamaḥ prapāṭhakaḥ
translated: The first section.

original: oṃ brahma ha vā idam agra āsīt svayaṃ tv ekam eva tad aikṣata mahad vai yakṣaṃ tad
analyzed: om brahma ha vai idam agre āsīt svayam tu ekam eva tat aikṣata mahat vai yakṣam tat
translated: Om. Brahman indeed was here in the beginning, but it was alone and desired greatness. It saw the great Yaksha.

original: ekam evāsmi hantāhaṃ mad eva manmātraṃ dvitīyaṃ devaṃ nirmama iti tad abhyaśrāmyad
analyzed: ekam eva asmi hantā aham mat eva mad mātram dvitīyam devam nirmame iti tat abhyaśrāmyat
translated: It thought, I am alone. I will create a second god, just like me. It became fatigued,

original: abhyatapat samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya lalāṭe sneho yad ārdryam
analyzed: abhyatapat samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya lalāṭe snehaḥ yat ārdryam
translated: heated, and intensely heated. From the sweat of its forehead, which was moist,

original: ājāyata tenānandat tam abravīt mahad vai yakṣaṃ suvedam avidāmaha iti /
analyzed: ājāyata tena anandat tam abravīt mahat vai yakṣam su vedam avidāmahe iti
translated: it rejoiced. It said, We have known the great Yaksha, which is well-known.

original: tad yad abravīt mahad vai yakṣaṃ suvedam avidāmaha iti tasmāt suvedo 'bhavattaṃ vā etaṃ suvedaṃ santaṃ sveda ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: tat yat abravīt mahat vai yakṣam su vedam avidāmahe iti tasmāt su vedaḥ bhavat tam vai etam su vedam santam svedaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: Because it said, We have known the great Yaksha, which is well-known, it became well-known. They call that which is known as sweat.

original: parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: Because the gods love the indirect and hate the direct, as it were.

original: sa bhūyo 'śrāmyad bhūyo 'tapyat bhūya ātmānaṃ samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya sarvebhyo romagartebhyaḥ pṛthak svedadhārāḥ prāsyandanta
analyzed: sa bhūyas śrāmyat bhūyas tapyat bhūyas ātmānam samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya sarvebhyaḥ romagartebhyaḥ pṛthak sveda dhārāḥ prāsyandanta
translated: He again toiled, again heated himself, again heated his self. For him, who was tired, heated, and heated up, from all the pores of his body, separate streams of sweat flowed.

original: tābhir anandat tad abravīd ābhir vā aham idaṃ sarvaṃ dhārayiṣyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃcābhir
analyzed: tābhiḥ anandat tat abravīt ābhiḥ vai aham idam sarvam dhārayiṣyāmi yat idam kiṃca ābhiḥ
translated: With them he rejoiced. He said: 'With these I shall indeed support all this whatever there is.

original: vā aham idaṃ sarvaṃ janayiṣyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃcābhir vā aham idaṃ sarvam āpsyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃceti /
analyzed: vai aham idam sarvam janayiṣyāmi yat idam kiṃca ābhiḥ vai aham idam sarvam āpsyāmi yat idam kiṃca iti
translated: With these I shall indeed generate all this whatever there is. With these I shall indeed attain all this whatever there is.'

original: tad yad abravīd ābhir vā aham idaṃ sarvaṃ dhārayiṣyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃceti tasmāt dhārā abhavaṃs taddhārāṇāṃ dhārātvaṃ yac cāsu dhriyate /🔽tad yad abravīd ābhir vā aham idaṃ sarvaṃ janayiṣyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃceti tasmāj jāyā
analyzed: tat yat abravīt ābhiḥ vai aham idam sarvam dhārayiṣyāmi yat idam kiṃca iti tasmāt dhārāḥ abhavan tat dhārāṇām dhārā tvam yat ca āsu dhriyate  tat yat abravīt ābhiḥ vai aham idam sarvam janayiṣyāmi yat idam kiṃca iti tasmāt jāyā
translated: Because he said: 'With these I shall indeed support all this whatever there is,' therefore they became streams. That is the streamness of the streams, and what is supported in them.

original: abhavaṃs tajjāyānāṃ jāyātvaṃ yac cāsu puruṣo jāyate yac ca putraḥ punnāmanarakam
analyzed: abhavan tad jāyānām jāyā tvam yat ca āsu puruṣaḥ jāyate yat ca putraḥ put nāma narakam
translated: Because he said: 'With these I shall indeed generate all this whatever there is,' therefore they became wives. That is the wifehood of the wives, and the man who is born in them, and the son named 'man'

original: anekaśatatāraṃ tasmāt trāti putras tat putrasya putratvam /
analyzed: aneka śata tāram tasmāt trāti putraḥ tat putrasya putra tvam
translated: who saves from the many hundreds of stars, therefore the son saves. That is the sonhood of the son.

original: tad yad abravīd ābhir vā aham idaṃ sarvam āpsyāmi yad idaṃ kiṃceti tasmād āpo 'bhavaṃs tad apām aptvam āpnoti vai sa sarvān kāmān yān kāmayate
analyzed: tat yat abravīt ābhiḥ vai aham idam sarvam āpsyāmi yat idam kiṃca iti tasmāt āpaḥ bhavan tat apām ap tvam āpnoti vai sa sarvān kāmān yān kāmayate
translated: Whatever he said, 'By these I shall obtain all this whatever there is', therefore they became the waters; that is the waterness of the waters; he obtains all his desires, whatever he desires.

original: tā apaḥ sṛṣṭvānvaikṣata tāsu svāṃ chāyām apaśyat tām asyekṣamāṇasya svayaṃ reto 'skandat
analyzed: tāḥ apaḥ sṛṣṭvā anvaikṣata tāsu svām chāyām apaśyat tām asya īkṣamāṇasya svayam retaḥ skandat
translated: Having created those waters, he looked at them; he saw his own shadow in them. While he was looking at it, his own seed fell out.

original: tad apsu pratyatiṣṭhat tās tatraivābhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tāḥ śrāntās taptāḥ
analyzed: tat apsu pratyatiṣṭhat tāḥ tatra eva abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tāḥ śrāntāḥ taptāḥ
translated: It settled in the waters; he wearied, scorched, heated them there. They, being wearied, scorched, heated,

original: saṃtaptāḥ sārdham eva retasā dvaidham abhavaṃs tāsām anyā anyatarā atilavaṇā apeyā
analyzed: saṃtaptāḥ sārdham eva retasā dvaidham abhavan tāsām anyāḥ anyatarā ati lavaṇā a peyā
translated: together with the seed became twofold. Of them, the other ones were very salty, undrinkable,

original: asvādvyas tā aśāntā retaḥ samudraṃ vṛtvātiṣṭhann athetarāḥ peyāḥ svādvyaḥ śāntās
analyzed: a svādvyaḥ tāḥ a śāntāḥ retaḥ samudram vṛtvā atiṣṭhan atha itarāḥ peyāḥ svādvyaḥ śāntāḥ
translated: unsatisfactory; they stood surrounding the seed-ocean. Then the other ones were drinkable, satisfactory, sweet.

original: tās tatraivābhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyas taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyo
analyzed: tāḥ tatra eva abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyaḥ taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyaḥ
translated: He wearied, scorched, heated them there. From them, being wearied, scorched, heated,

original: yad reta āsīt tad abhṛjjyata yad abhṛjjyata tasmād bhṛguḥ samabhavat tad bhṛgor bhṛgutvaṃ
analyzed: yat retaḥ āsīt tat abhṛjjyata yat abhṛjjyata tasmāt bhṛguḥ samabhavat tat bhṛgoḥ bhṛgu tvam
translated: whatever seed there was, that was churned; what was churned, from that Bhṛgu came into being. That is Bhṛgu's Bhṛgūtva.

original: bhṛgur iva vai sa sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti ya evaṃ veda // / / //🔽sa bhṛguṃ sṛṣṭvāntaradhīyata sa bhṛguḥ sṛṣṭaḥ prāṅ ejatataṃ vāg anvavadad vāyo vāyo🔽iti saṃnyavartata sa dakṣiṇāṃ diśam ejatataṃ vāg anvavadat mātariśvan mātariśvann🔽iti sa nyavartata sa pratīcīṃ diśam ejatataṃ vāg anvavadat pavamānaḥ pavamāna iti🔽sa nyavartata sa udīcīṃ diśam ejatataṃ vāg anvavadad vāta vāteti tam abravīn nanv
analyzed: bhṛguḥ iva vai sa sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti yaḥ evam veda  sa bhṛgum sṛṣṭvā antaradhīyata sa bhṛguḥ sṛṣṭaḥ prāṅ ejatatam vāc anvavadat vāyo vāyo  iti saṃnyavartata sa dakṣiṇām diśam ejatatam vāc anvavadat mātariśvat mātariśvan  iti sa nyavartata sa pratīcīm diśam ejatatam vāc anvavadat pavamānaḥ pavamānaḥ iti  sa nyavartata saḥ udīcīm diśam ejatatam vāc anvavadat vāta vāta iti tam abravīt nanu
translated: He shines in all the worlds like Bhrigu, who knows thus.

original: avidāmaha iti na hīty athārvāṅ enam etāsv evāpsv anviccheti tad yad abravīd athārvāṅ🔽enam etāsv evāpsv anviccheti tad atharvābhavat tad atharvaṇo 'tharvatvam /
analyzed: avidāmahe iti na hi iti atha arvāṅ enam etāsu eva apsu anviccha iti tat yat abravīt atha arvāṅ  enam etāsu eva apsu anviccha iti tat atharvā abhavat tat atharvaṇaḥ tharva tvam
translated: Having created Bhrigu, he disappeared. That Bhrigu, when created, went forth. Speech followed him and said, Vayu, Vayu. He turned back. He went to the southern direction. Speech followed him and said, Marichi, Marichi. He turned back. He went to the western direction. Speech followed him and said, Pavamana, Pavamana. He turned back. He went to the northern direction. Speech followed him and said, Vata, Vata. He said to him, Let us not know. No, he said. Then seek him here in these very waters. In that he said, Then seek him here in these very waters, that is how Atharvan came to be. That is the origin of Atharvan.

original: tasya ha vā etasya bhagavato 'tharvaṇa ṛṣer yatheva brahmaṇī lomāni yathāṅgāni yathā
analyzed: tasya ha vai etasya bhagavataḥ tharvaṇaḥ ṛṣeḥ yathā iva brahmaṇī lomāni yathā aṅgāni yathā
translated: Now, of that blessed sage Atharvan, just as the hair and the limbs are of Brahma,

original: prāṇa evam evāsya sarva ātmā samabhavat tam atharvāṇaṃ brahmābravīt prajāpateḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: prāṇaḥ evam eva asya sarvaḥ ātmā samabhavat tam atharvāṇam brahmā abravīt prajāpateḥ prajāḥ
translated: In the same way, his entire self became the vital breath. Then Brahmā said to Atharvan:

original: sṛṣṭvā pālayasveti /
analyzed: sṛṣṭvā pālayasva iti
translated: Having created the creatures of Prajāpati, protect them.

original: tad yad abravīt prajāpateḥ prajā sṛṣṭvā pālayasveti tasmāt prajāpatir abhavat tat
analyzed: tat yat abravīt prajāpateḥ prajā sṛṣṭvā pālayasva iti tasmāt prajāpatiḥ abhavat tat
translated: Because he said this, Having created the creatures of Prajāpati, protect them, therefore he became Prajāpati. That is

original: prajāpateḥ prajāpatitvam atharvā vai prajāpatiḥ prajāpatir iva vai sa sarveṣu lokeṣu
analyzed: prajāpateḥ prajāpati tvam atharvā vai prajāpatiḥ prajāpatiḥ iva vai sa sarveṣu lokeṣu
translated: the state of Prajāpati of Prajāpati. Atharvan is Prajāpati. One shines like Prajāpati in all the worlds

original: bhāti ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: bhāti yaḥ evam veda
translated: who knows this.

original: tam atharvāṇam ṛṣim abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tasmāc chrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāt
analyzed: tam atharvāṇam ṛṣim abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tasmāt śrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāt
translated: He tormented, heated, and scorched the sage Atharvan. From him, exhausted, heated, and scorched,

original: daśatayān atharvaṇa ṛṣīn niramimataikarcān dvyṛcāṃs tṛcāṃś caturṛcān pañcarcān ṣaḍarcān
analyzed: daśatayān atharvaṇaḥ ṛṣīn niramimata eka ṛcān dvi ṛcān tṛcān catur ṛcān pañca ṛcān ṣaḍarcān
translated: he emitted the tenfold Atharvan seers, those of one verse, two verses, three verses, four verses, five verses, six verses,

original: saptarcān aṣṭarcān navarcān daśarcān iti /
analyzed: sapta ṛcān aṣṭa ṛcān nava ṛcān daśa ṛcān iti
translated: seven verses, eight verses, nine verses, and ten verses.

original: tān atharvaṇa ṛṣīn abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ
analyzed: tān atharvaṇaḥ ṛṣīn abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ
translated: He tormented, heated, and scorched those Atharvan seers. From them, exhausted, heated, and scorched,

original: saṃtaptebhyaḥ daśatayān ātharvaṇān ārṣeyān niramimataikādaśān dvādaśāṃs trayodaśāṃś
analyzed: saṃtaptebhyaḥ daśatayān ātharvaṇān ārṣeyān niramimata ekādaśān dvādaśān trayodaśān
translated: he emitted the tenfold Atharvan descendants, those of eleven, twelve, and thirteen.

original: caturdaśān pañcadaśān ṣoḍaśān saptadaśān aṣṭādaśān navadaśān viṃśān iti /🔽tān atharvaṇa ṛṣīn ātharvaṇāṃś cārṣeyān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ
analyzed: caturdaśān pañcadaśān ṣoḍaśān saptadaśān aṣṭādaśān navadaśān viṃśān iti  tān atharvaṇaḥ ṛṣīn ātharvaṇān ca ārṣeyān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ
translated: fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, nineteen, twenty.🔽He then tormented and heated the Rishis of the Atharva Veda and their disciples.

original: śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyo yān mantrān apaśyat sa ātharvaṇo vedo 'bhavat
analyzed: śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ yān mantrān apaśyat saḥ ātharvaṇaḥ vedaḥ bhavat
translated: From them, when they were tired, heated, and greatly heated, he saw the mantras. That became the Atharva Veda.

original: tam ātharvaṇaṃ vedam abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tasmāc chrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptād
analyzed: tam ātharvaṇam vedam abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tasmāt śrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāt
translated: He tormented and heated that Atharva Veda. From it, when it was tired, heated, and greatly heated,

original: om iti mana evordhvam akṣaram udakrāmat sa ya icchet sarvair etair atharvabhiś cātharvaṇī
analyzed: om iti manaḥ eva ūrdhvam akṣaram udakrāmat sa yaḥ icchet sarvaiḥ etaiḥ atharvabhiḥ ca ātharvaṇī
translated: the syllable Om, the mind, arose upwards. One who wishes to perform all these Atharvan and Atharvanee

original: kurvīyety etayaiva taṃ mahāvyāhṛtyā kurvīta /
analyzed: kurvīya iti etayā eva tam mahāvyāhṛtyā kurvīta
translated: rites should perform them with this great Vyāhṛti.

original: sarvair ha vā asyaitair atharvabhiś cātharvaṇaiś ca kṛtaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute // / /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ ha vai asya etaiḥ atharvabhiḥ ca ātharvaṇaiḥ ca kṛtam bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute  /
translated: For him, all these Atharvan and Atharvanee rites are performed, who knows thus, and who, knowing thus, performs them with this great Vyāhṛti.

original: sa bhūyo 'śrāmyad bhūyo 'tapyad bhūya ātmānaṃ samatapat sa ātmata eva trīṃl lokān niramimata pṛthivīm antarikṣaṃ divam iti /
analyzed: sa bhūyas śrāmyat bhūyas tapyat bhūyas ātmānam samatapat saḥ ātmataḥ eva trīn lokān niramimata pṛthivīm antarikṣam divam iti
translated: He again toiled, again he heated, again he heated himself. He created the three worlds from his own self, the earth, the atmosphere, and the sky.

original: sa khalu pādābhyām eva pṛthivīṃ niramimatodarād antarikṣam mūrdhno divam /
analyzed: sa khalu pādābhyām eva pṛthivīm niramimata udarāt antarikṣam mūrdhnaḥ divam
translated: He created the earth from his feet, the atmosphere from his belly, and the sky from his head.

original: sa tāṃs trīn lokān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyas trīn devān niramimatāgniṃ vāyum ādityam iti
analyzed: sa tān trīn lokān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ trīn devān niramimata agnim vāyum ādityam iti
translated: He toiled, heated, and heated intensely those three worlds. From them, when tired, heated, and intensely heated, he created the three gods, Agni, Vayu, and Aditya.

original: sa khalu pṛthivyā evāgniṃ niramimatāntarikṣād vāyuṃ diva ādityam /
analyzed: sa khalu pṛthivyāḥ eva agnim niramimata antarikṣāt vāyum divaḥ ādityam
translated: He created Agni from the earth, Vayu from the atmosphere, and Aditya from the sky.

original: sa tāṃs trīn devān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ
analyzed: sa tān trīn devān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ
translated: He toiled, heated, and heated intensely those three gods. From them, when tired, heated, and intensely heated,

original: saṃtaptebhyas trīn vedān niramimata ṛgvedaṃ yajurvedaṃ sāmavedam iti agne ṛgvedaṃ
analyzed: saṃtaptebhyaḥ trīn vedān niramimata ṛgvedam yajurvedam sāmavedam iti agne ṛgvedam
translated: he created the three Vedas, the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the Sama Veda. Agni the Rig Veda,

original: vāyor yajurvedam ādityāt sāmavedam /
analyzed: vāyoḥ yajurvedam ādityāt sāmavedam
translated: Vayu the Yajur Veda, and Aditya the Sama Veda.

original: sa tāṃs trīn vedān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyas tisro mahāvyāhṛtīr niramimata bhūr bhuvaḥ
analyzed: sa tān trīn vedān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ tisraḥ mahāvyāhṛtīḥ niramimata bhūḥ bhuvaḥ  /
translated: He wearied, heated, and scorched those three Vedas. From them, when wearied, heated, and scorched, he produced the three great Vyahritis: Bhuḥ, Bhuvaḥ,

original: svar iti /
analyzed: svar iti
translated: Svaḥ.

original: bhūr ity ṛgvedāt bhuva iti yajurvedāt svar iti sāmavedāt /🔽sa ya icchet sarvair etais tribhir vedaiḥ kurvīyety etābhir eva taṃ mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ🔽kurvīta sarvair ha vā asyaitais tribhir vedaiḥ kṛtaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ
analyzed: bhūḥ iti ṛgvedāt bhuvaḥ iti yajurvedāt svar iti sāmavedāt  sa yaḥ icchet sarvaiḥ etaiḥ tribhiḥ vedaiḥ kurvīya iti etābhiḥ eva tam mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ  kurvīta sarvaiḥ ha vai asya etaiḥ tribhiḥ vedaiḥ kṛtam bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam
translated: Bhuḥ from the Rig Veda, Bhuvaḥ from the Yajur Veda, Svaḥ from the Sama Veda.🔽 He who wishes to perform with all these three Vedas should perform with these great Vyahritis.

original: vidvān evam etābhir mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurute // / / //
analyzed: vidvān evam etābhiḥ mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurute
translated: For him, all these three Vedas are performed, he who knows thus, and he who, knowing thus, performs with these great Vyahritis in this way.

original: tā yā amū retaḥ samudraṃ vṛtvātiṣṭhaṃs tāḥ prācyo dakṣiṇācyaḥ pratīcya udīcyaḥ samavadravanta /
analyzed: tāḥ yāḥ amūḥ retaḥ samudram vṛtvā atiṣṭhan tāḥ prācyaḥ dakṣiṇācyaḥ pratīcyaḥ udīcyaḥ samavadravanta
translated: Those which stood surrounding the ocean of semen, they rushed together from the east, south, west, and north.

original: tad yat samavadravanta tasmāt samudra ucyate /
analyzed: tat yat samavadravanta tasmāt samudraḥ ucyate
translated: Because they rushed together, it is called the ocean.

original: tā bhītā abruvan bhagavantam eva vayaṃ rājānaṃ vṛṇīmaha iti /
analyzed: tāḥ bhītāḥ abruvan bhagavantam eva vayam rājānam vṛṇīmahe iti
translated: They, being afraid, said, 'We choose the Lord himself as our king.'

original: yac ca vṛtvātiṣṭhaṃs tadvaraṇo 'bhavat taṃ vā etaṃ varaṇaṃ santaṃ varuṇa ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: yat ca vṛtvā atiṣṭhan tad varaṇaḥ bhavat tam vai etam varaṇam santam varuṇaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: And because he stood after having been chosen, he became Varuna. Him, who is Varuna, they call by the name Varuna.

original: parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love the indirect, as it were, and hate the direct.

original: sa samudrād amucyata sa mucyur abhavat taṃ vā etaṃ mucyuṃ santaṃ mṛtyur ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: sa samudrāt amucyata sa mucyuḥ abhavat tam vai etam mucyum santam mṛtyuḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: He was freed from the ocean. He became Mucyu. Him, who is Mucyu, they call by the name of Death.

original: parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love the indirect, as it were, and hate the direct.

original: taṃ varuṇaṃ mṛtyum abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya
analyzed: tam varuṇam mṛtyum abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tasya śrāntasya taptasya saṃtaptasya
translated: He wearied, heated, and scorched Varuna, Death. From him, who was wearied, heated, and scorched,

original: sarvebhyo 'ṅgebhyo raso 'kṣarat so 'ṅgaraso 'bhavat taṃ vā etam aṅgarasaṃ santam
analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ kṣarat saḥ ṅga rasaḥ bhavat tam vai etam aṅga rasam santam
translated: the essence oozed out from all his limbs. He became the essence of the limbs. Him, who is the essence of the limbs,

original: aṅgirā ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: aṅgirāḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: they call by the name Angiras.

original: parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love the indirect, as it were, and hate the direct.

original: tam aṅgirasam ṛṣim abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tasmāc chrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptād
analyzed: tam aṅgirasam ṛṣim abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tasmāt śrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāt
translated: He wearied, heated, and scorched the sage Angiras. From him, who was wearied, heated, and scorched,

original: viṃśino 'ṅgirasa ṛṣīn niramimata tān viṃśino 'ṅgirasa ṛṣīn abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat
analyzed: viṃśinaḥ ṅgirasaḥ ṛṣīn niramimata tān viṃśinaḥ ṅgirasaḥ ṛṣīn abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat
translated: He created the twenty-fold, the Aṅgiras Ṛṣis. He tormented, heated, and scorched the twenty-fold Aṅgiras Ṛṣis.

original: samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyo daśatayān āṅgirasān ārṣeyān
analyzed: samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ daśatayān āṅgirasān ārṣeyān
translated: From them, when they were tired, heated, and scorched, he created the ten-fold Aṅgiras descendants of the Ṛṣis,

original: niramimata ṣoḍaśino 'ṣṭādaśino dvādaśina ekarcāṃs tṛcāṃś caturṛcān pañcarcān ṣaḍarcān
analyzed: niramimata ṣoḍaśinaḥ ṣṭādaśinaḥ dvādaśinaḥ eka ṛcān tṛcān catur ṛcān pañca ṛcān ṣaḍarcān
translated: the sixteen-fold, the eighteen-fold, the twelve-fold, the one-versed, the three-versed, the four-versed, the five-versed, the six-versed,

original: dvyṛcān saptarcān iti /
analyzed: dvi ṛcān sapta ṛcān iti
translated: the two-versed, and the seven-versed.

original: tān aṅgirasa ṛṣīn āṅgirasāṃś cārṣeyān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas🔽taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyo yān mantrān apaśyatsa āṅgiraso vedo 'bhavat tam āṅgirasaṃ
analyzed: tān aṅgirasaḥ ṛṣīn āṅgirasān ca ārṣeyān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ  taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ yān mantrān apaśyat saḥ āṅgirasaḥ vedaḥ bhavat tam āṅgirasam
translated: He tormented, heated, and scorched the Aṅgiras Ṛṣis and the Aṅgiras descendants of the Ṛṣis. From them, when they were tired,🔽heated, and scorched, he saw the mantras. That became the Aṅgiras Veda. He tormented, heated, and scorched that Aṅgiras Veda. From it, when it was tired,

original: vedam abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tasmāc chrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāj janad iti
analyzed: vedam abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tasmāt śrāntāt taptāt saṃtaptāt janat iti
translated: heated, and scorched, he created the Jānadyās.

original: dvaitam akṣaraṃ vyabhavat /
analyzed: dvaitam akṣaram vyabhavat
translated: The dual syllable arose.

original: sa ya icchet sarvair etair aṅgirobhiś cāṅgirasaiś ca kurvīyety etayaiva taṃ mahāvyāhṛtyā
analyzed: sa yaḥ icchet sarvaiḥ etaiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ ca āṅgirasaiḥ ca kurvīya iti etayā eva tam mahāvyāhṛtyā
translated: One who wishes to perform with all these Aṅgiras and Aṅgiras descendants should do so with this great Vyāhṛti.

original: kurvīta sarvair ha vā asyaitair aṅgirobhiś cāṅgirasaiś ca kṛtaṃ bhavati ya eva veda
analyzed: kurvīta sarvaiḥ ha vai asya etaiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ ca āṅgirasaiḥ ca kṛtam bhavati yaḥ eva veda
translated: He who knows thus makes all these limbs and the Angiras and the Angirasas his own.

original: yaś caiva vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ ca eva vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute
translated: And he who, knowing thus, performs this great invocation in this way...

original: sa ūrdhvo 'tiṣṭhat sa imāṃl lokān vyaṣṭabhnāt tasmād aṅgiraso 'dhīyāna ūrdhvas tiṣṭhati
analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhat saḥ imān lokān vyaṣṭabhnāt tasmāt aṅgirasaḥ dhīyānaḥ ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: It stood erect. It supported these worlds. Therefore, one who studies the Angiras stands erect.

original: tad vrataṃ sa manasā dhyāyed yad vā ahaṃ kiṃcana manasā dhyāsyāmi tathaiva tad bhaviṣyati
analyzed: tat vratam sa manasā dhyāyet yat vai aham kiṃcana manasā dhyāsyāmi tathā eva tat bhaviṣyati
translated: He should meditate on that vow in his mind: Whatever I shall meditate on in my mind, that will come to be.

original: taddha sma tathaiva bhavati /
analyzed: tat ha sma tathā eva bhavati
translated: And that comes to be just so.

original: tad apy etad ṛcoktam /
analyzed: tat api etat ṛcā uktam
translated: And that is said in this verse:

original: śreṣṭho ha vedas tapaso 'dhijāto brahmajyānāṃ kṣitaye saṃbabhūva ṛjyad bhūtaṃ yad asṛjyatedaṃ niveśanam anṛṇaṃ dūram asyeti /
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ ha vedaḥ tapasaḥ dhi jātaḥ brahmajyānām kṣitaye saṃbabhūva ṛjyat bhūtam yat asṛjyata idam niveśanam anṛṇam dūram asya iti
translated: The Veda, born from austerity, is the best. It has come into being for the sake of the Brahmins' offspring. The truth that has been created, this abode, is debtless and far-reaching.

original: tā vā etā aṅgirasāṃ yāmayo yan menayaḥ karoti menibhir vīryaṃ ya eva veda // / / //
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ aṅgirasām yāmayaḥ yat menayaḥ karoti menibhiḥ vīryam yaḥ eva veda
translated: These are the Yama hymns of the Angiras, the thoughts. He who knows thus makes his own the strength of the thoughts.

original: sa diśau 'nvaikṣata prācīṃ dakṣiṇāṃ pratīcīm udīcīṃ dhruvām ūrdhvām iti /
analyzed: sa diśau nvaikṣata prācīm dakṣiṇām pratīcīm udīcīm dhruvām ūrdhvām iti
translated: It looked at the directions: east, south, west, north, the stable one, and the upward one.

original: tās tatraivābhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyas taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyaḥ pañca vedān niramimata sarpavedaṃ piśācavedam asuravedam
analyzed: tāḥ tatra eva abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyaḥ taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyaḥ pañca vedān niramimata sarpa vedam piśāca vedam asura vedam
translated: He toiled, heated, and intensely heated them. From them, when tired, heated, and intensely heated, he emitted the five Vedas: the Serpent Veda, the Piśāca Veda, the Asura Veda,

original: itihāsavedaṃ purāṇavedam iti /
analyzed: itihāsa vedam purāṇa vedam iti
translated: the Itihāsa Veda, and the Purāṇa Veda.

original: sa khalu prācyā eva diśaḥ sarpavedaṃ niramimata dakṣiṇasyāḥ piśācavedaṃ pratīcyā asuravedam udīcyā itihāsavedaṃ dhruvāyāś cordhvāyāś ca purāṇavedam
analyzed: sa khalu prācyāḥ eva diśaḥ sarpa vedam niramimata dakṣiṇasyāḥ piśāca vedam pratīcyāḥ asura vedam udīcyāḥ itihāsa vedam dhruvāyāḥ ca ūrdhvāyāḥ ca purāṇa vedam
translated: He emitted the Serpent Veda from the eastern direction, the Piśāca Veda from the southern direction, the Asura Veda from the western direction, the Itihāsa Veda from the northern direction, and the Purāṇa Veda from the firm and upper directions.

original: sa tān pañca vedān abhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyas taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ pañca mahāvyāhṛtīr niramimata vṛdhat karad
analyzed: sa tān pañca vedān abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tebhyaḥ śrāntebhyaḥ taptebhyaḥ saṃtaptebhyaḥ pañca mahāvyāhṛtīḥ niramimata vṛdhat karat  /
translated: He toiled, heated, and intensely heated those five Vedas. From them, when tired, heated, and intensely heated, he emitted the five great Vyahṛtis: Vṛdhat, Krad,

original: guhan mahat tad iti /
analyzed: guhat mahat tat iti
translated: Guhat, Mahat, and Tat.

original: vṛdhad iti sarpavedāt karad iti piśācavedāt guhad ity asuravedāt mahad itītihāsavedāt
analyzed: vṛdhat iti sarpa vedāt karat iti piśāca vedāt guhat iti asura vedāt mahat iti itihāsa vedāt
translated: Vṛdhat from the Serpent Veda, Krad from the Piśāca Veda, Guhat from the Asura Veda, Mahat from the Itihāsa Veda,

original: tad iti purāṇavedāt sa ya icchet sarvair etaiḥ pañcabhir vedaiḥ kurvīyety etābhir
analyzed: tat iti purāṇa vedāt sa yaḥ icchet sarvaiḥ etaiḥ pañcabhiḥ vedaiḥ kurvīya iti etābhiḥ
translated: and Tat from the Purāṇa Veda. He who wishes to perform with all these five Vedas, with these

original: eva taṃ mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurvīta sarvair ha vā asyaitaiḥ pañcabhir vedaiḥ kṛtaṃ bhavati
analyzed: eva tam mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurvīta sarvaiḥ ha vai asya etaiḥ pañcabhiḥ vedaiḥ kṛtam bhavati
translated: He should perform it with the Mahâvyâhritis. By all these five Vedas is it performed for him

original: ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etābhir mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurute // / / //🔽sa āvataś ca parāvataś cānvaikṣata tās tatraivābhyaśrāmyad abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyas taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyaḥ śam ity ūrdhvam
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etābhiḥ mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ kurute  saḥ āvataḥ ca parāvataḥ ca anvaikṣata tāḥ tatra eva abhyaśrāmyat abhyatapat samatapat tābhyaḥ śrāntābhyaḥ taptābhyaḥ saṃtaptābhyaḥ śam iti ūrdhvam
translated: who knows this, and who, knowing this, performs it with these Mahâvyâhritis.

original: akṣaram udakrāmat /🔽sa ya icchet sarvābhir etābhir āvadbhiś ca parāvadbhiś ca kurvīyety etayaiva taṃ
analyzed: akṣaram udakrāmat  sa yaḥ icchet sarvābhiḥ etābhiḥ āvadbhiḥ ca parāvadbhiḥ ca kurvīya iti etayā eva tam
translated: He looked out for the past and the future. He wearied himself, he heated himself, he heated his self with them. From them, when they were wearied, heated, and heated through, the syllable 'S' went forth upwards.🔽He who desires to perform with all these past and future (Vedas),

original: mahāvyāhṛtyā kurvīta sarvābhir ha vā asyaitābhir āvadbhiś ca parāvadbhiś ca kṛtaṃ
analyzed: mahāvyāhṛtyā kurvīta sarvābhiḥ ha vai asya etābhiḥ āvadbhiḥ ca parāvadbhiḥ ca kṛtam
translated: he should perform it with this Mahâvyâhriti. By all these past and future (Vedas) is it performed for him

original: bhavati ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute // / / //
analyzed: bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etayā mahāvyāhṛtyā kurute
translated: who knows this, and who, knowing this, performs it with this Mahâvyâhriti.

original: sa bhūyo 'śrāmyat bhūyo 'tapyat bhūya ātmānaṃ samatapat sa manasa eva candramasaṃ
analyzed: sa bhūyas śrāmyat bhūyas tapyat bhūyas ātmānam samatapat sa manasaḥ eva candramasam
translated: He wearied himself more, he heated himself more, he heated his self more. From his mind the moon went forth.

original: niramimata nakhebhyo nakṣatrāṇi lomabhya oṣadhivanaspatīn kṣudrebhyaḥ prāṇebhyo 'nyān bahūn devān /
analyzed: niramimata nakhebhyaḥ nakṣatrāṇi lomabhyaḥ oṣadhi vanaspatīn kṣudrebhyaḥ prāṇebhyaḥ nyān bahūn devān
translated: From his nails he created the stars, from his hair the herbs and trees, from his minor vital airs many other gods.

original: sa bhūyo 'śrāmyad bhūyo 'tapyat bhūya ātmānaṃ samatapat sa etaṃ trivṛtaṃ saptatantum ekaviṃśatisaṃsthaṃ yajñam apaśyat /
analyzed: sa bhūyas śrāmyat bhūyas tapyat bhūyas ātmānam samatapat saḥ etam trivṛtam sapta tantum ekaviṃśati saṃstham yajñam apaśyat
translated: He toiled again, he heated himself again, he heated his self again. He saw this sacrifice consisting of three parts, with seven threads, and completed in twenty-one parts.

original: tad apy etad ṛcoktam /
analyzed: tat api etat ṛcā uktam
translated: This is also stated in the Ṛg Veda:

original: agnir yajñaṃ trivṛtaṃ saptatantum iti /
analyzed: agniḥ yajñam trivṛtam sapta tantum iti
translated: Agni saw the sacrifice consisting of three parts, with seven threads.

original: athāpy eṣa prākrīḍitaḥ ślokaḥ pratyabhivadati sapta sutyāḥ sapta ca pākayajñā iti // / / //
analyzed: atha api eṣa prākrīḍitaḥ ślokaḥ pratyabhivadati sapta sutyāḥ sapta ca pākayajñāḥ iti
translated: And this verse of Prakriti's son is also recited: There are seven Soma sacrifices and seven Pākayajñas.

original: tam āharat yenāyajata tasyāgnir hotāsīt vāyur adhvaryuḥ sūrya udgātā candramā brahmā
analyzed: tam āharat yena ayajata tasya agniḥ hotā āsīt vāyuḥ adhvaryuḥ sūryaḥ udgātā candramāḥ brahmā
translated: He performed it, Agni was his Hotṛ priest, Vāyu his Adhvaryu, Sūrya his Udgātṛ, Candrama his Brahman,

original: parjanyaḥ sadasya oṣadhivanaspatayaś camasā adhvaryavo viśvedevā hotrakā atharvāṅgiraso
analyzed: parjanyaḥ sadasyaḥ oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ camasāḥ adhvaryavaḥ viśvedevāḥ hotrakāḥ atharva aṅgirasaḥ
translated: Parjanya his Sadasya, the herbs and trees his Chamasādhvaryus, the Viśvedevas his Hotrakas, the Atharvāṅgirasas

original: goptāras taṃ ha smaitam evaṃ vidvāṃsaḥ pūrve śrotriyā yajñaṃ tataṃ sāvasāya ha smāhety
analyzed: goptāraḥ tam ha sma etam evam vidvāṃsaḥ pūrve śrotriyāḥ yajñam tatam sa avasāya ha sma āha iti
translated: his Gopas. Those who knew this, the ancient Srotriyas, having completed the sacrifice, said thus.

original: abhivrajanti mā no 'yaṃ gharma udyataḥ pramattānām amṛtāḥ prajāḥ prasākṣīd iti tān
analyzed: abhivrajanti mā naḥ yam gharmaḥ udyataḥ pramattānām amṛtāḥ prajāḥ prasākṣīt iti tān
translated: They go forth, thinking, May this Gharma, when it has risen, not destroy our offspring, while we are heedless.

original: vāyetān parirakṣakān sadaḥprasarpakān ity ācakṣate dakṣiṇāsamṛddhāṃs tad u ha smāha
analyzed: vāyetān parirakṣakān sadaḥprasarpakān iti ācakṣate dakṣiṇā samṛddhān tat u ha sma āha
translated: They call them the protectors, the spreaders of the assembly. As for the Dakshina being accomplished, Prajapati said this:

original: prajāpatir yad vai yajñe 'kuśalā ṛtvijo bhavanty acaritino brahmacaryam aparāgyā
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ yat vai yajñe kuśalāḥ ṛtvijaḥ bhavanti a caritinaḥ brahmacaryam aparāgyā
translated: If the priests in the sacrifice are unskilled, have not practiced celibacy, have not observed the rules,

original: vā tad vai yajñasya viriṣṭam ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: vā tat vai yajñasya viriṣṭam iti ācakṣate
translated: then that, they say, is a flaw in the sacrifice.

original: yajñasya viriṣṭam anuyajamāno viriṣyate yajamānasya viriṣṭam anvṛtvijo viriṣyanta
analyzed: yajñasya viriṣṭam anu yajamānaḥ viriṣyate yajamānasya viriṣṭam anu ṛtvijaḥ viriṣyanta
translated: After the flaw in the sacrifice, the sacrificer is flawed. After the flaw in the sacrificer, the priests are flawed.

original: ṛtvijāṃ viriṣṭam anudakṣiṇā viriṣyante dakṣiṇānāṃ viriṣṭam anuyajamānaḥ putrapaśubhir
analyzed: ṛtvijām viriṣṭam anu dakṣiṇāḥ viriṣyante dakṣiṇānām viriṣṭam anu yajamānaḥ putra paśubhiḥ
translated: After the flaw in the priests, the Dakshina is flawed. After the flaw in the Dakshina, the sacrificer is flawed in offspring and cattle.

original: viriṣyate putrapaśūnāṃ viriṣṭam anuyajamānaḥ svarge lokena viriṣyate svargasya lokasya
analyzed: viriṣyate putra paśūnām viriṣṭam anuyajamānaḥ svarge lokena viriṣyate svargasya lokasya
translated: After the flaw in offspring and cattle, the sacrificer is flawed in the heavenly world. After the flaw in the heavenly world,

original: viriṣṭam anu tasyārdhasya yogakṣemo viriṣyate yasminn ardhe yajanta iti brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: viriṣṭam anu tasya ardhasya yogakṣemaḥ viriṣyate yasmin ardhe yajante iti brāhmaṇam
translated: the prosperity and security of that quarter in which they perform the sacrifice is flawed. This is the Brahmana.

original: taṃ ha smaitam evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brahmāṇaṃ yajñaviriṣṭo vā yajñaviriṣṭino vety upādhāveran
analyzed: tam ha sma etam evam vidvāṃsam brahmāṇam yajña viriṣṭaḥ vā yajña viriṣṭinaḥ vā iti upādhāveran
translated: To him, thus knowing, they used to run, saying, 'Our sacrifice has failed, or is failing.'

original: namas te astu bhagavan yajñasya no viriṣṭaṃ saṃdhehīti tad yatraiva viriṣṭaṃ syāt
analyzed: namaḥ te astu bhagavan yajñasya naḥ viriṣṭam saṃdhehi iti tat yatra eva viriṣṭam syāt
translated: 'Adoration be to thee, O exalted one! Make whole to us what is amiss in our sacrifice.' Wherever there is anything amiss,

original: tatrāgnīn upasamādhāya śāntyudakaṃ kṛtvā pṛthivyai śrotrāyeti trir evāgnīn samprokṣati
analyzed: tatra agnīn upasamādhāya śāntyudakam kṛtvā pṛthivyai śrotrāya iti tris eva agnīn samprokṣati
translated: there he should put the fires in order, should prepare the water for quieting, and should sprinkle the fires three times with, 'To the earth, to the hearing' .

original: triḥ paryukṣati triḥ kārayamāṇam ācāmayati ca samprokṣati ca yajñavāstu ca samprokṣaty

translated: desires, all worlds, all gods, all Vedas, all sacrifices, all

translated: What do the students utter? What is the meter? What is the letter? These are the previous questions. Then the following is the mantra:

original: kalpo brāhmaṇam ṛgyajuḥ sāma kasmād brahmavādina oṃkāram āditaḥ kurvanti kiṃ devataṃ
analyzed: kalpaḥ brāhmaṇam ṛk yajuḥ sāma kasmāt brahma vādinaḥ oṃkāram āditas kurvanti kim devatam
translated: The Kalpa, the Brahmana, the Rig, Yajus, and Sama Vedas. Why do the expounders of Brahman begin with Om? What is the deity?

original: kiṃ jyotiṣaṃ kiṃ niruktaṃ kiṃ sthānaṃ kā prakṛtiḥ kim adhyātmam iti ṣaṭtriṃśat praśnāḥ
analyzed: kim jyotiṣam kim niruktam kim sthānam kā prakṛtiḥ kim adhyātmam iti ṣaṭtriṃśat praśnāḥ
translated: What is the light? What is the Nirukta? What is the place? What is the original nature? What is the inner self? These are the thirty-six questions.

original: pūrvottarāṇāṃ trayo vargā dvādaśakā etair oṃkāraṃ vyākhyāsyāmaḥ // / / //🔽indraḥ prajāpatim apṛcchad bhagavann abhisūya pṛcchāmīti pṛccha vatsety abravīt kim
analyzed: pūrva uttarāṇām trayaḥ vargāḥ dvādaśakāḥ etaiḥ oṃkāram vyākhyāsyāmaḥ  indraḥ prajāpatim apṛcchat bhagavan abhisūya pṛcchāmi iti pṛccha vatsa iti abravīt kim
translated: The first and last are divided into three groups of twelve. With these we will explain Om.🔽Indra asked Prajapati, O Lord, I ask out of envy. He said, Ask, O son. What is this Om? Whose son is it? What is its meter? What is its letter? And what is its Brahman?

original: ayam oṃkāraḥ kasya putraḥ kiṃ caitac chandaḥ kiṃ caitadvarṇaḥ kiṃcaitad brahmā brahma
analyzed: ayam oṃkāraḥ kasya putraḥ kim ca etat chandaḥ kim ca etad varṇaḥ kim ca etat brahmā brahma
translated: Brahman

original: sampadyate tasmād vai tadbhadram oṃkāraṃ pūrvam ālebhe svaritodātta ekākṣara oṃkāra
analyzed: sampadyate tasmāt vai tat bhadram oṃkāram pūrvam ālebhe svarita udāttaḥ eka akṣaraḥ oṃkāra
translated: Therefore, that is auspicious. He first grasped the Oṃkāra, which is a single syllable with a svarita and udātta accent.

original: ṛgvede traisvaryodātta ekākṣara oṃkāro yajurvede dīrghaplutodātta ekākṣara oṃkāraḥ
analyzed: ṛgvede traisvarya udāttaḥ eka akṣaraḥ oṃkāraḥ yajurvede dīrgha pluta udāttaḥ eka akṣaraḥ oṃkāraḥ
translated: In the Ṛg Veda, the Oṃkāra has a triṣvarya and udātta accent and is a single syllable. In the Yajur Veda, the Oṃkāra is a single syllable with a long and prolated udātta accent.

original: sāmavede hrasvodātta ekākṣara oṃkāro 'tharvaveda udāttodāttadvipada a u ity ardhacatasro
analyzed: sāmavede hrasva udāttaḥ eka akṣaraḥ oṃkāraḥ tharvavedaḥ udātta udātta dvipadaḥ a u iti ardha catasraḥ
translated: In the Sāma Veda, the Oṃkāra is a single syllable with a short udātta accent. In the Atharva Veda, the Oṃkāra is a two-syllable word with an udātta and udātta accent, namely a u.

original: mātrā makāre vyañjanam ity āhur yā sā prathamā mātrā brahmadevatyā raktā varṇena
analyzed: mātrā makāre vyañjanam iti āhuḥ yā sā prathamā mātrā brahma devatyā raktā varṇena
translated: There are four and a half mātrās. They say that the consonant is in the letter ma. The first mātrā is presided over by Brahmā,

original: yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacched brāhmyaṃ padaṃ yā sā dvitīyā mātrā viṣṇudevatyā🔽kṛṣṇā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacched vaiṣṇavaṃ padaṃ yā sā tṛtīyā mātraiśānadevatyā
analyzed: yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet brāhmyam padam yā sā dvitīyā mātrā viṣṇu devatyā  kṛṣṇā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet vaiṣṇavam padam yā sā tṛtīyā mātrā aiśāna devatyā
translated: and is red in color. One who always meditates on it goes to the state of Brahman. The second mātrā is presided over by Viṣṇu,🔽and is black in color. One who always meditates on it goes to the state of Viṣṇu. The third mātrā is presided over by Īśāna,

original: kapilā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacched aiśānaṃ padaṃ yā sārdhacaturthī🔽mātrā sarvadevatyā vyaktībhūtā khaṃ vicarati śuddhasphaṭikasaṃnibhā varṇena yas tāṃ
analyzed: kapilā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet aiśānam padam yā sārdhacaturthī 🔽mātrā sarva devatyā vyaktībhūtā kham vicarati śuddha sphaṭika saṃnibhā varṇena yaḥ tām
translated: and is tawny in color. One who always meditates on it goes to the state of Īśāna. The fourth and a half mātrā,🔽which is presided over by all the gods, becomes manifest and moves in the sky, and is white in color like pure crystal. One who always meditates on it goes to the state of all the gods.

original: dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacchet padam anāmakam oṃkārasya cotpattir vipro yo na jānāti
analyzed: dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet padam anāmakam oṃkārasya ca utpattiḥ vipraḥ yaḥ na jānāti
translated: He who always meditates on it, goes to the state of the Nameless. The origin of the syllable Om, a Brahmin who does not know

original: tat punar upanayanaṃ tasmād brāhmaṇavacanam ādartavyaṃ yathā lātavyo gotro brahmaṇaḥ
analyzed: tat punar upanayanam tasmāt brāhmaṇa vacanam ādartavyam yathā lātavyaḥ gotraḥ brahmaṇaḥ
translated: that is his re-initiation. Therefore, the statement of the Brahmins should be respected, just as the statement of Lātavyagotra, the son of Brahmin

original: putro gāyatraṃ chandaḥ śuklo varṇaḥ puṃso vatso rudro devatā oṃkāro vedānām // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ gāyatram chandaḥ śuklaḥ varṇaḥ puṃsaḥ vatsaḥ rudraḥ devatā oṃkāraḥ vedānām
translated: the Gayatri meter, the white color, the bull of the male, Rudra as the deity, the syllable Om of the Vedas.

original: ko dhātur ity āpṛr dhātur avatim apy eke rūpasāmānyād arthasāmānyanedīyas tasmād
analyzed: kaḥ dhātuḥ iti āpṛḥ dhātuḥ avatim api eke rūpa sāmānyāt artha sāmānya nedīyaḥ tasmāt
translated: What is the root? The root is apa. Some say avati, due to the similarity of form, the similarity of meaning is near. Therefore,

original: āper oṃkāraḥ sarvam āpnotīty arthaḥ kṛdantam arthavat prātipadikam adarśanaṃ pratyayasya
analyzed: āpeḥ oṃkāraḥ sarvam āpnoti iti arthaḥ kṛt antam arthavat prātipadikam adarśanam pratyayasya
translated: from apa, the syllable Om. The meaning is: it obtains everything. The nominal stem ending in a verbal root has meaning. The suffix is not seen.

original: nāma sampadyate nipāteṣu cainaṃ vaiyākaraṇā udāttaṃ samāmananti tad avyayībhūtam
analyzed: nāma sampadyate nipāteṣu ca enam vaiyākaraṇāḥ udāttam samāmananti tat avyayībhūtam
translated: It becomes a name. And the grammarians recite it as accented among the indeclinables. That is the indeclinable.

original: anvarthavācī śabdo na vyeti kadācaneti /
analyzed: anvartha vācī śabdaḥ na vyeti kadācana iti
translated: A word that expresses a meaning never changes.

original: sadṛśaṃ triṣu liṅgeṣu sarvāsu ca vibhaktiṣu /
analyzed: sadṛśam triṣu liṅgeṣu sarvāsu ca vibhaktiṣu
translated: Similar in all three genders and in all case endings,

original: vacaneṣu ca sarveṣu yan na vyeti tad avyayam /
analyzed: vacaneṣu ca sarveṣu yat na vyeti tat avyayam
translated: and in all verbal forms, that which does not change is indeclinable.

original: ko vikārī cyavate prasāraṇam āptotirāva ā pakārī vikāryāvādita oṃkāro vikriyate dvitīyo makāra eva dvivarṇa ekākṣara oṃ ity oṃkāro nirvṛtaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ vikārī cyavate prasāraṇam oṃkārī vikriyate dvitīyaḥ makāraḥ eva dvi varṇaḥ eka akṣaraḥ om iti oṃkāraḥ nirvṛtaḥ
translated: Who is the one who changes and falls away? The first Õṃkāra is stretched out, the second is the M-sound itself, the two letters are one syllable, Õṃ is the completed Õṃkāra.

original: katimātra ityādes tisro mātrā abhyādāne hi plavate makāraś caturthīṃ kiṃ sthānam
analyzed: kati mātraḥ ityādeḥ tisraḥ mātrāḥ abhyādāne hi plavate makāraḥ caturthīm kim sthānam
translated: How many mātrās does it have? It has three mātrās, for the M-sound floats in the abhyāsa. What is the fourth? What is the place?

original: ity ubhāv oṣṭhau sthānaṃ nādānupradānakaraṇau ca dvayasthānaṃ saṃdhyakṣaram avarṇaleśaḥ
analyzed: iti ubhau oṣṭhau sthānam nāda anupradāna karaṇau ca dvaya sthānam saṃdhyakṣaram avarṇa leśaḥ
translated: Both lips are the place, and they are the instruments for the giving and receiving of sound. The syllable in the middle has two places. It is a part of the vowel.

original: kaṇṭhyo yathoktaśeṣaḥ pūrvo vivṛtakaraṇasthitaś ca dvitīyaspṛṣṭakaraṇasthitaś ca
analyzed: kaṇṭhyaḥ yathā ukta śeṣaḥ pūrvaḥ vivṛta karaṇa sthitaḥ ca dvitīya spṛṣṭa karaṇa sthitaḥ ca
translated: The guttural is the remainder as stated. The first is in the open instrument, and the second is in the closed instrument.

original: na saṃyogo vidyūta ākhyātopasargānudāttasvaritaliṅgavibhaktivacanāni ca saṃsthānādhyāyina
analyzed: na saṃyogaḥ vidyūte ākhyāta upasarga anudātta svarita liṅga vibhakti vacanāni ca saṃsthāna adhyāyinaḥ
translated: There is no conjunction. The sounds of the Vedas, prefixes, anudātta, svarita, genders, and case endings are the rules of the grammarians.

original: ācāryāḥ pūrve babhūvuḥ śravaṇād eva pratipadyante nakāraṇaṃ pṛcchanty athāparapakṣīyāṇāṃ
analyzed: ācāryāḥ pūrve babhūvuḥ śravaṇāt eva pratipadyante na kāraṇam pṛcchanti atha aparapakṣīyāṇām
translated: The teachers of old existed. They understood from hearing alone. They did not ask for reasons. Then there were those of the later period.

original: kaviḥ pañcālacaṇḍaḥ paripṛcchako babhūvāṃ vu pṛthag udgīthadoṣān bhavanto bruvantv
analyzed: kaviḥ pañcālacaṇḍaḥ paripṛcchakaḥ babhūvām pṛthak udgītha doṣān bhavantaḥ bruvantu
translated: The poet Pañcāla-caṇḍa was the questioner. He asked the sages to explain the faults of the Udgītha separately.

original: iti tad vāpy upalakṣayed varṇākṣarapadāṅkaśo vibhaktyām ṛṣiniṣevitām iti vācaṃ stuvanti
analyzed: iti tat vā api upalakṣayet varṇa akṣara pada aṅkaśas vibhaktyām ṛṣi niṣevitām iti vācam stuvanti
translated: Thus, one should recognize that, marked by letters, syllables, and words, it is attended to by the sages in the case endings. Thus they praise speech.

original: tasmāt kāraṇaṃ brūmo varṇānām ayam idaṃ bhaviṣyatīti ṣaḍaṅgavidas tat tathādhīmahe /
analyzed: tasmāt kāraṇam brūmaḥ varṇānām ayam idam bhaviṣyati iti ṣaḍaṅga vidaḥ tat tathā adhīmahe
translated: Therefore, we state the reason: This will be of the letters. Those who know the six limbs think of it thus.

original: kiṃ chanda iti gāyatraṃ hi chando gāyatrī vai devānām ekākṣarā śvetavarṇā ca vyākhyātā
analyzed: kim chandaḥ iti gāyatram hi chandaḥ gāyatrī vai devānām eka akṣarā śveta varṇā ca vyākhyātā
translated: What is the meter? Indeed, the meter is Gāyatrī. Gāyatrī is explained as being the one syllable of the gods and having the color white.

original: dvau dvādaśakau vargāv etad vai vyākaraṇaṃ dhātvarthavacanaṃ śaikṣyaṃ chandovacanaṃ
analyzed: dvau dvādaśakau vargau etat vai vyākaraṇam dhātvartha vacanam śaikṣyam chandaḥ vacanam
translated: The two groups of twelve, this is indeed grammar, the statement of the meaning of roots, the statement of the Vedas,

original: cāthottarau dvau dvādaśakau vargau vedarahasikī vyākhyātā mantraḥ kalpo brāhmaṇam
analyzed: ca atha uttarau dvau dvādaśakau vargau vedarahasikī vyākhyātā mantraḥ kalpaḥ brāhmaṇam
translated: and the two subsequent groups of twelve are explained as the secret of the Vedas, mantra, kalpa, and brāhmaṇa.

original: ṛg yajuḥ sāmātharvāṇy eṣā vyāhṛtiś caturṇāṃ vedānām ānupūrveṇoṃ bhūr bhuvasvar iti
analyzed: ṛc yajuḥ sāma atharvāṇi eṣā vyāhṛtiḥ caturṇām vedānām ānupūrveṇa oṃ bhūḥ bhuvasvar iti
translated: Ṛg, Yajuḥ, Sāman, and Atharvaṇa - this is the vyāhṛti of the four Vedas in order: om bhūr bhuvaḥ svar.

original: vyāhṛtayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyāhṛtayaḥ
translated: The vyāhṛtis are...

original: asamīkṣapravahlitāni śrūyante dvāparādāv ṛṣīṇām ekadeśo doṣapatir iha cintām āpede
analyzed: asamīkṣa pravahlitāni śrūyante dvāpara ādau ṛṣīṇām eka deśaḥ doṣa patiḥ iha cintām āpede
translated: It is heard that rash statements were made by the sages at the beginning of the Dvāpara age. A part of them, under the sway of faults, became anxious here.

original: tribhiḥ somaḥ pātavyaḥ samāptam iva bhavati tasmād ṛgyajuḥsāmāny apakrāntatejāṃsy
analyzed: tribhiḥ somaḥ pātavyaḥ samāptam iva bhavati tasmāt ṛk yajuḥ sāmāni apakrānta tejāṃsi
translated: Soma is to be drunk in three parts, as if it were finished. Therefore, Ṛg, Yajuḥ, and Sāman have lost their radiance.

original: āsaṃs tatra maharṣayaḥ paridevayāṃcakrire mahac chokabhayaṃ prāptāsmo na caitat sarvaiḥ
analyzed: āsan tatra mahā ṛṣayaḥ paridevayāṃcakrire mahat śoka bhayam prāptāsmaḥ na ca etat sarvaiḥ
translated: There were great sages who lamented and said, We have attained great grief and fear, but this has not been said by all of us.

original: samabhihitaṃ te vayaṃ bhagavantam evopadhāvāma sarveṣām eva śarma bhavānīti te tathety
analyzed: samabhihitam te vayam bhagavantam eva upadhāvāma sarveṣām eva śarma bhavāni iti te tathā iti
translated: We go to the Blessed One himself for the welfare of all. They said, So be it,

original: uktvā tūṣṇīm atiṣṭhan nānupasannebhya ity upopasīdāmīti nīcair babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: uktvā tūṣṇīm atiṣṭhat na an upasannebhyaḥ iti upopasīdāmi iti nīcaiḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: and remained silent. I will approach those who have not approached, he said, and became humble.

original: sa ebhya upanīya provāca māmikām eva vyāhṛtim āditaḥ āditaḥ kṛṇudhvam ity evaṃ māmakā ādhīyante /
analyzed: saḥ ebhyaḥ upanīya provāca māmikām eva vyāhṛtim āditas āditas kṛṇudhvam iti evam māmakāḥ ādhīyante
translated: He initiated them and said, From the beginning, make my own utterance. Thus my own are established.

original: narte bhṛgvaṅgirovidbhyaḥ somaḥ pātavya ṛtvijaḥ parābhavanti yajamāno rajasāpadhyasyati
analyzed: na ṛte bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ vidbhyaḥ somaḥ pātavyaḥ ṛtvijaḥ parābhavanti yajamānaḥ rajasā apadhyasyati
translated: Soma should not be drunk by those who do not know the hymns of Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras. The priests are defeated. The sacrificer is overcome by dust.

original: śrutiś cāpadhyastā tiṣṭhatīty evam evottarottarād yogāt tokaṃ tokam praśādhvam ity
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca apadhyastā tiṣṭhati iti evam eva uttara uttarāt yogāt tokam tokam praśādhvam iti
translated: And the heard is overthrown and remains. Thus, from one connection to another, rule your offspring and offspring.

original: evaṃ pratāpo na parābhaviṣyatīti tathāha tathāha bhagavann iti pratipedira āpyāyayaṃs
analyzed: evam pratāpaḥ na parābhaviṣyati iti tathā āha tathā āha bhagavan iti pratipedire āpyāyayan
translated: Thus, the heat will not be defeated. So be it, he said. So be it, Blessed One, they replied. They were satisfied.

original: te tathā vītaśokabhayā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: te tathā vīta śoka bhayāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Thus, they became free from grief and fear.

original: tasmād brahmavādina oṃkāram āditaḥ kurvanti // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt brahma vādinaḥ oṃkāram āditas kurvanti
translated: Therefore, the expounders of Brahman make the syllable Om at the beginning.

original: kiṃdevatam ity ṛcām agnir devataṃ tad eva jyotir gāyatraṃ chandaḥ pṛthivī sthānam /
analyzed: kiṃdevatam iti ṛcām agniḥ devatam tat eva jyotiḥ gāyatram chandaḥ pṛthivī sthānam
translated: As for the deity of the Ṛc verses, the deity is Agni, that is the light, the Gāyatrī meter, the earth is the place.

original: agnim īḍe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam /
analyzed: agnim īḍe purohitam yajñasya devam ṛtvijam
translated: I praise Agni, the priest, the god, the officiating priest of the sacrifice,

original: hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam ity evam ādiṃ kṛtvā ṛgvedam adhīyate /
analyzed: hotāram ratna dhātamam iti evam ādim kṛtvā ṛgvedam adhīyate
translated: the hotar, the bestower of treasures, and so on, thus beginning, the Ṛg Veda is studied.

original: yajuṣāṃ vāyur devataṃ tad eva jyotiḥ traiṣṭubhaṃ chando 'ntarikṣaṃ sthānam /
analyzed: yajuṣām vāyuḥ devatam tat eva jyotiḥ traiṣṭubham chandaḥ ntarikṣam sthānam
translated: As for the Yajuṣ formulas, the deity is Vāyu, that is the light, the Triṣṭubh meter, the atmosphere is the place.

original: ikhe tv orje tvā vāyava stha devo vaḥ savitā prārpayatu /
analyzed: ikhe tvā ā ūrje tvā vāyavaḥ stha devaḥ vaḥ savitā prārpayatu
translated: In the syllable khe, for strength, for you, O Vāyu, the god Savitr shall impel you,

original: śreṣṭhatamāya karmaṇa ity evam ādiṃ kṛtvā yajurvedam adhīyate /
analyzed: śreṣṭhatamāya karmaṇe iti evam ādim kṛtvā yajurvedam adhīyate
translated: for the most excellent rite, and so on, thus beginning, the Yajur Veda is studied.

original: sāmnām ādityo devataṃ tad eva jyotir jāgataṃ chando dyau sthānam /
analyzed: sāmnām ādityaḥ devatam tat eva jyotiḥ jāgatam chandaḥ dyauḥ sthānam
translated: As for the Sāman chants, the deity is the sun, that is the light, the Jagatī meter, the sky is the place.

original: agna āyāhi vītaye gṛṇāno havyadātaye /
analyzed: agne āyāhi vītaye gṛṇānaḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Agni, come for the feast, being praised, for the offering of oblations,

original: nihotā satsi barhiṣīty evam ādiṃ kṛtvā sāmavedam adhīyate /
analyzed: nihotā satsi barhiṣi iti evam ādim kṛtvā sāmavedam adhīyate
translated: sitting as the offerer on the sacred grass, and so on, thus beginning, the Sāma Veda is studied.

original: atharvaṇāṃ candramā devataṃ tad eva jyotiḥ sarvāṇi chandāṃsy āpaḥ sthānam /
analyzed: atharvaṇām candramāḥ devatam tat eva jyotiḥ sarvāṇi chandāṃsi āpaḥ sthānam
translated: As for the Atharvaṇa mantras, the deity is the moon, that is the light, all the meters, the waters are the place.

original: śanno deve rabhiṣṭa ya ity evam ādiṃ kṛtvā atharvavedam adhīyate /
analyzed: śat naḥ deve rabhiṣṭa ye iti evam ādim kṛtvā atharvavedam adhīyate
translated: May the god who is most bountiful to us, and so on, thus beginning, the Atharva Veda is studied.

original: adbhyaḥ sthāvarajaṅgamo bhūtagrāmaḥ sambhavati tasmāt sarvam āpomayaṃ bhūtaṃ sarvaṃ bhṛgvaṅgiromayam /
analyzed: adbhyaḥ sthāvara jaṅgamaḥ bhūta grāmaḥ sambhavati tasmāt sarvam āpaḥ mayam bhūtam sarvam bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ mayam
translated: The world of beings, both moving and unmoving, originates from water. Therefore, all beings are made of water, all are made of Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras.

original: antaraite trayo vedā bhṛgūn aṅgirasaḥ śritā ity ab iti prakṛtir apām oṃkāreṇa caitasmād

original: vyāsaḥ purovāca bhṛgvaṅgirovidā saṃskṛto 'nyān vedān adhīyīta nānyatra saṃskṛto bhṛgvaṅgiraso

original: 'dhīyīta atha sāmavede khilaśrutiḥ brahmacaryeṇa caitasmād atharvāṅgiraso ha yo vedaḥ

analyzed: hi prabalaḥ viṣayī syāt sarvasmin vākaḥ vākye iti brāhmaṇam  etat ha sma etat vidvāṃsam ekādaśākṣam maudgalyam glāvaḥ maitre yaḥ bhyājagāma sa tasmin  brahmacaryam vasataḥ vijñāya uvāca kim svid maryāḥ ayam tam maudgalyaḥ dhyeti yat asmin

analyzed: iti tam ha upeyāya tam ha upetya papraccha kim svid āhuḥ bhoḥ savituḥ vareṇyam bhargo
translated: He said: 'I have come to you.' Having come to him, he asked: 'What, sir, do they say is Savita's most excellent light,

translated: the god's? What do the wise say are the thoughts? Consider if you can tell me by which of those Savita impels, by which he goes.'

analyzed: sāvitrī yatra hi eva candramāḥ tat nakṣatrāṇi yatra vai nakṣatrāṇi tat candramāḥ iti 🔽ete dve yonī ekam mithunam ahar eva savitā rātriḥ sāvitrī yatra hi eva ahar tat rātriḥ 🔽yatra vai rātriḥ tat ahar iti ete dve yonī ekam mithunam uṣṇam eva savitā śītam sāvitrī 🔽yatra hi eva uṣṇam tat śītam yatra vai śītam tat uṣṇam iti ete dve yonī ekam mithunam
translated: Where there is earth, there is fire. These are two sources, one pair. The wind itself is Savita, the atmosphere is Savitri. translated: 'That excellent of Savita' is the first foot of the Savitri. He placed the earth verse with the verse, Agni with Agni.

original: agninā śriyaṃ śriyā striyaṃ striyā mithunaṃ mithunena prajāṃ prajayā karma karmaṇā
analyzed: agninā śriyam śriyā striyam striyā mithunam mithunena prajām prajayā karma karmaṇā
translated: With prosperity, a woman with prosperity, a couple with a couple, offspring with offspring, action with action,

translated: a Brahmin becomes refined, not empty, not cut off, his thread is not cut off,🔽his life is not cut off, his existence is not cut off, he who knows thus, and he who, knowing thus, explains this first foot of the Sāvitrī

original: prathamaṃ pādaṃ vyācaṣṭe // / / //

translated: The second foot of the Sāvitrī is bhargó devásya dhīmahi (we meditate on the divine light). He joined the Yajur Veda with the atmosphere, the Yajur Veda with

translated: the cattle with the rite, the rite with austerity, austerity with truth, truth with Brahman, Brahman with the Brahmins,

analyzed: vratam vratena vai brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśitaḥ bhavati a śūnyaḥ bhavati a vicchinnaḥ bhavati a vicchinnaḥ
translated: the Brahmins with the vow. A Brahmin becomes refined through the vow, not empty, not cut off, his thread is not cut off,

original: 'sya tantur avicchinnaṃ jīvanaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etaṃ
analyzed: sya tantuḥ avicchinnam jīvanam bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etam
translated: his life is not cut off, he who knows thus, and he who, knowing thus, explains this second foot of the

original: sāvitryā dvitīyaṃ pādaṃ vyācaṣṭe // / / //
analyzed: sāvitryāḥ dvitīyam pādam vyācaṣṭe
translated: Sāvitrī thus...

analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt iti sāvitryāḥ tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ divā sāma samadadhāt sāmnā ādityam
translated: The third quarter of the Savitri, May he inspire our prayers, he placed in the day, in the Saman, the Saman in the sun,
