analyzed: ādityena raśmīn raśmibhiḥ varṣam varṣeṇa oṣadhi vanaspatīn oṣadhi vanaspatibhiḥ paśūn
translated: the sun in the rays, the rays in the rain, the rain in the plants and trees, the plants and trees in the cattle,

original: paśubhiḥ karma karmaṇā tapas tapasā satyaṃ satyena brahma brahmaṇā brāhmaṇaṃ brāhmaṇena
analyzed: paśubhiḥ karma karmaṇā tapaḥ tapasā satyam satyena brahma brahmaṇā brāhmaṇam brāhmaṇena
translated: the cattle in the sacrifice, the sacrifice in austerity, austerity in truth, truth in Brahman, Brahman in the Brahmana,

original: vrataṃ vratena vai brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśito bhavaty aśūnyo bhavaty avicchinno bhavaty avicchinno🔽'sya tantur avicchinnaṃ jīvanaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etaṃ
analyzed: vratam vratena vai brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśitaḥ bhavati a śūnyaḥ bhavati a vicchinnaḥ bhavati a vicchinnaḥ  sya tantuḥ avicchinnam jīvanam bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etam
translated: the Brahmana in the vow. The Brahmana becomes sharpened by the vow, becomes not empty, becomes not interrupted, his thread of life becomes not interrupted,

original: sāvitryās tṛtīyaṃ pādaṃ vyācaṣṭe // / / //
analyzed: sāvitryāḥ tṛtīyam pādam vyācaṣṭe
translated: he who knows thus, and he who knowing thus explains this third quarter of the Savitri to others.

original: tena ha vā evaṃ viduṣā brāhmaṇena brahmābhipannaṃ grasitaṃ parāmṛṣṭaṃ brahmaṇākāśam
analyzed: tena ha vai evam viduṣā brāhmaṇena brahma abhipannam grasitam parāmṛṣṭam brahmaṇā ākāśam
translated: By him who knows thus, by a Brahmana who knows thus, the Brahman is entered, swallowed, seized, by the Brahman the space is entered, swallowed, seized,

original: abhipannaṃ grasitaṃ parāmṛṣṭam ākāśena vāyur abhipanno grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭo vāyunā
analyzed: abhipannam grasitam parāmṛṣṭam ākāśena vāyuḥ abhipannaḥ grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭaḥ vāyunā
translated: by the space the wind is entered, swallowed, seized, by the wind the light is entered, swallowed, seized, by the light the moon and sun are entered, swallowed, seized, by the moon and sun the stars are entered, swallowed, seized, by the stars the quarters are entered, swallowed, seized, by the quarters the world is entered, swallowed, seized, by the world the beings are entered, swallowed, seized, by the beings the sacrifice is entered, swallowed, seized, by the sacrifice the oblations are entered, swallowed, seized, by the oblations the Soma is entered, swallowed, seized, by the Soma the Brahman is entered, swallowed, seized, by the Brahman the Brahmana is entered, swallowed, seized, by the Brahmana the vow is entered, swallowed, seized, by the vow the Brahmana becomes sharpened, becomes not empty, becomes not interrupted, his thread of life becomes not interrupted.

original: jyotir abhipannaṃ grasitaṃ parāmṛṣṭaṃ jyotiṣāpo 'bhipannā grasitāḥ parāmṛṣṭā adbhir
analyzed: jyotiḥ abhipannam grasitam parāmṛṣṭam jyotiṣā apaḥ bhipannāḥ grasitāḥ parāmṛṣṭāḥ adbhiḥ
translated: The light was swallowed, seized, and taken away by the water. The water was swallowed, seized, and taken away by the fire.🔽

original: bhūmir abhipannā grasitā parāmṛṣṭā bhūmyānnam abhipannaṃ grasitaṃ parāmṛṣṭam annena
analyzed: bhūmiḥ abhipannā grasitā parāmṛṣṭā bhūmyā annam abhipannam grasitam parāmṛṣṭam annena
translated: The waters are swallowed, seized, and taken away by the light. The earth is swallowed, seized, and taken away by the waters.

original: prāṇo 'bhipanno grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭaḥ prāṇena mano 'bhipannaṃ grasitaṃ parāmṛṣṭaṃ manasā
analyzed: prāṇaḥ bhipannaḥ grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭaḥ prāṇena manaḥ bhipannam grasitam parāmṛṣṭam manasā
translated: Food is swallowed, seized, and taken away by the earth. Prana is swallowed, seized, and taken away by food. The mind is swallowed, seized, and taken away by prana.

original: vāg abhipannā grasitā parāmṛṣṭā vācā vedā abhipannā grasitāḥ parāmṛṣṭā vedair yajño
analyzed: vāc abhipannā grasitā parāmṛṣṭā vācā vedāḥ abhipannāḥ grasitāḥ parāmṛṣṭāḥ vedaiḥ yajñaḥ
translated: Speech is swallowed, seized, and taken away by the mind. The Vedas are swallowed, seized, and taken away by speech. The sacrifice is swallowed, seized, and taken away by the Vedas.

original: 'bhipanno grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭas tāni ha vā etāni dvādaśamahābhūtāny evaṃ vidhipratiṣṭhitāni
analyzed: abhipannaḥ grasitaḥ parāmṛṣṭaḥ tāni ha vai etāni dvādaśa mahābhūtāni evam vidhi pratiṣṭhitāni
translated: Indeed, these twelve great elements are thus established by the rules.

original: teṣāṃ yajña eva parārdhyaḥ // / / //🔽te ha smaitam evaṃ vidvāṃso manyante vidmainam iti yāthātathyam avidvāṃso 'yaṃ yajño
analyzed: teṣām yajñaḥ eva parārdhyaḥ  te ha sma etam evam vidvāṃsaḥ manyante vidma enam iti yāthātathyam a vidvāṃsaḥ yam yajñaḥ
translated: Among them, the sacrifice is the most excellent.

original: vedeṣu pratiṣṭhito vedā vāci pratiṣṭhitā vāṅ manasi pratiṣṭhitā manaḥ prāṇe pratiṣṭhitaṃ
analyzed: vedeṣu pratiṣṭhitaḥ vedāḥ vāci pratiṣṭhitāḥ vāc manasi pratiṣṭhitā manaḥ prāṇe pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Those who know this think thus: We know him as he really is. Those who do not know think: This sacrifice is established in the Vedas. The Vedas are established in speech. Speech is established in the mind. The mind is established in prana.

original: prāṇo 'nne pratiṣṭhito 'nnaṃ bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaṃ bhūmir apsu pratiṣṭhitā āpo jyotiṣi
analyzed: prāṇaḥ nne pratiṣṭhitaḥ nnam bhūmau pratiṣṭhitam bhūmiḥ apsu pratiṣṭhitāḥ āpaḥ jyotiṣi
translated: Life is established in food, food is established on the earth, the earth is established in the waters, the waters are established in the light,

original: pratiṣṭhitā jyotir vāyau pratiṣṭhitaṃ vāyur ākāśe pratiṣṭhita ākāśaṃ brahmaṇi pratiṣṭhitaṃ
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitāḥ jyotiḥ vāyau pratiṣṭhitam vāyuḥ ākāśe pratiṣṭhitaḥ ākāśam brahmaṇi pratiṣṭhitam
translated: the light is established in the wind, the wind is established in space, space is established in Brahman,

original: brahma brāhmaṇe brahmavidi pratiṣṭhitaṃ yo ha vā evaṃ vit sa brahmavit puṇyāṃ ca
analyzed: brahma brāhmaṇe brahma vidi pratiṣṭhitam yaḥ ha vai evam vid sa brahma vid puṇyām ca
translated: Brahman is established in the Brahman who knows Brahman. He who knows thus is a knower of Brahman. He attains auspicious

original: kīrtiṃ labhate surabhīṃś ca gandhān so 'pahatapāpmānantyaśriyam aśnute ya evaṃ veda
analyzed: kīrtim labhate surabhīn ca gandhān saḥ u pahata pāpmā anantya śriyam aśnute yaḥ evam veda
translated: fame and fragrant scents. He enjoys imperishable glory who knows thus.

original: yaś caivaṃ vidvān evam etāṃ vedānāṃ mātaraṃ sāvitrīsampadam upaniṣadam upāsta iti
analyzed: yaḥ ca evam vidvān evam etām vedānām mātaram sāvitrī sampadam upaniṣadam upāste iti
translated: And he who, knowing thus, worships this mother of the Vedas, the wealth of the Savitri, the Upanishad, thus,

original: brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇam
translated: is a Brahmana.

original: āpo garbhaṃ janayantīr ity apāṅgarbhaḥ puruṣaḥ sa yajño 'dbhir yajñaḥ praṇīyamānaḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ garbham janayantīḥ iti apām garbhaḥ puruṣaḥ sa yajñaḥ dbhiḥ yajñaḥ praṇīyamānaḥ
translated: The waters, generating the embryo, the person in the womb of the waters, that is the sacrifice. The sacrifice is carried forward with the waters.

original: prāṅṇāyate tasmād ācamanīyaṃ pūrvam āhārayati sa yadācāmati trir ācāmati dviḥ pariśumbhaty
analyzed: prāṅ nāyate tasmāt ācamanīyam pūrvam āhārayati sa yat ācāmati tris ācāmati dvis pariśumbhati
translated: It moves forward with the breath. Therefore, one should first bring the water for sipping. When one sips, one sips three times, wipes twice,

original: āyur avaruhya pāpmānaṃ nirṇudaty upasādya yajuṣoddhṛtya mantrān prayujyāvasāya prācīḥ
analyzed: āyuḥ avaruhya pāpmānam nirṇudati upasādya yajuṣā uddhṛtya mantrān prayujya avasāya prācīḥ
translated: having descended into life, he drives away evil. Having placed it, having extracted the mantras from the Yajus, having employed them, having turned to the east,

original: śākhāḥ saṃdhāyonir aṅguṣṭhe pāṇāv amṛtam asya mṛtopastaraṇam asya mṛtāya tvopastṛṇāmīti
analyzed: śākhāḥ saṃdhāya ūniḥ aṅguṣṭhe pāṇau amṛtam asya mṛtopastaraṇam asya mṛtāya tvā upastṛṇāmi iti
translated: Having joined the branches, he says, 'In the thumb is his birthplace; in the hand is his nectar; he is the covering for the dead; for the dead I spread thee.'

original: pāṇāv udakam ānīya jīvāstheti sūktena trir ācāmati /
analyzed: pāṇau udakam ānīya jīva astha iti sūktena tris ācāmati
translated: Having brought water in his hand, he sips it three times with the verse, 'May I live.'

original: sa yat pūrvam ācāmati sapta prāṇāṃs tān etenāsminn āpyāyayati yā hy emā vāhyāḥ śarīrān
analyzed: sa yat pūrvam ācāmati sapta prāṇān tān etena asmin āpyāyayati yāḥ hi ā imāḥ vāhyāḥ śarīrān
translated: When he sips the first time, he thereby satisfies in him the seven vital airs, for these are the outer measures of the body.

original: mātrās tad yathaitad agniṃ vāyum ādityaṃ candramasam apaḥ paśūn anyāṃś ca prajās
analyzed: mātrāḥ tat yathā etat agnim vāyum ādityam candramasam apaḥ paśūn anyān ca prajāḥ
translated: Just as he satisfies in him the fire, the wind, the sun, the moon, the waters, the cattle, and other creatures,

original: tān etenāsminn āpyāyayaty āpo 'mṛtam /
analyzed: tān etena asmin āpyāyayati āpaḥ mṛtam
translated: he thereby satisfies in him the waters, the nectar.

original: sa yad dvitīyam ācāmati saptāpānāṃs tān etenāsmin āpyāyayati yā hy emā vāhyāḥ śarīrān
analyzed: sa yat dvitīyam ācāmati sapta apānān tān etena asmin āpyāyayati yāḥ hi ā imāḥ vāhyāḥ śarīrān
translated: When he sips the second time, he thereby satisfies in him the seven downward breaths, for these are the outer measures of the body.

original: mātrās tad yathaitat paurṇamāsīm aṣṭakām amāvāsyāṃ śraddhāṃ dīkṣāṃ yajñaṃ dakṣiṇās
analyzed: mātrāḥ tat yathā etat paurṇamāsīm aṣṭakām amāvāsyām śraddhām dīkṣām yajñam dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: Just as he satisfies in him the full moon, the eighth day, the new moon, faith, consecration, sacrifice, and sacrificial fees,

original: tān etenāsminn āpyāyayaty āpo 'mṛtam /
analyzed: tān etena asmin āpyāyayati āpaḥ mṛtam
translated: he thereby satisfies in him the waters, the nectar.

original: sa yat tṛtīyam ācāmati sapta vyānāṃs tān etenāsminn āpyāyayati yā hy emā vāhyāḥ śarīrān
analyzed: sa yat tṛtīyam ācāmati sapta vyānān tān etena asmin āpyāyayati yāḥ hi ā imāḥ vāhyāḥ śarīrān
translated: When he sips the third time, he thereby satisfies in him the seven cross-breaths, for these are the outer measures of the body.

original: mātrās tad yathaitat pṛthivīm antarīkṣaṃ divannakṣatrāeyṛtūnārtavān saṃvatsarāṃs
analyzed: mātrāḥ tat yathā etat pṛthivīm antarīkṣam divat nakṣatrā ei ṛtūn ārtavān saṃvatsarān
translated: The measures are those, just as this: the earth, the atmosphere, the sky, the stars, the seasons, the half-months, the months,

original: tān etenāsminn āpyāyayaty āpo 'mṛtaṃ puruṣo brahmāthāpriyanigamo bhavati tasmād vai
analyzed: tān etena asmin āpyāyayati āpaḥ mṛtam puruṣaḥ brahma atha apriya nigamaḥ bhavati tasmāt vai
translated: he satisfies them in this (world) with this (verse). The waters are the nectar, the person is Brahman, and then one becomes one who has gone to the end of the unpleasant. Therefore,

original: vidvān puruṣam idaṃ puṇḍarīkam iti prāṇa eṣa sa puri śete saṃpuriśaṃta iti /
analyzed: vidvān puruṣam idam puṇḍarīkam iti prāṇaḥ eṣa sa puri śete saṃpuriśaṃtaḥ iti
translated: the wise one calls the person 'this lotus,' for the breath is he who lies within the city, filling the city.

original: puriśayaṃ santaṃ prāṇaṃ puruṣa ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: puriśayam santam prāṇam puruṣaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: They call the breath, which is within the body, 'person.'

original: parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love the indirect, as it were, and hate the direct.

original: sa yat pūrvam ācāmati purastāddhomāṃs tenāsminn avarundhe sa yad dvitīyam ācāmaty
analyzed: sa yat pūrvam ācāmati purastāddhomān tena asmin avarundhe sa yat dvitīyam ācāmati
translated: When he sips water for the first time, before the offerings to the gods, he thereby wins him (Agni) over. When he sips water for the second time,

original: ājyabhāgau tenāsminn avarundhe sa yat tṛtīyam ācāmati saṃsthitahomāṃs tenāsminn avarundhe
analyzed: ājyabhāgau tena asmin avarundhe sa yat tṛtīyam ācāmati saṃsthita homān tena asmin avarundhe
translated: with the two portions of ghee he thereby wins him over. When he sips water for the third time, with the offerings at the end of the sacrifice he thereby wins him over.

original: sa yad dviḥ pariśumbhati tat samitsaṃbarhiḥ sa yat sarvāṇi khāni sarvaṃ deham āpyāyayati
analyzed: sa yat dvis pariśumbhati tat samidh saṃbarhiḥ sa yat sarvāṇi khāni sarvam deham āpyāyayati
translated: When he smooths (the fire) twice, that is the kindling wood and the sacrificial grass. When he satisfies all the cavities and the whole body,

original: yac cānyad ātāraṃ mantrakāryaṃ yajñe skandati sarvaṃ tenāsminn avarundhe sa yad oṃpūrvān mantrān prayuṅkta
analyzed: yat ca anyat ātāram mantra kāryam yajñe skandati sarvam tena asmin avarundhe sa yat oṃ pūrvān mantrān prayuṅkta
translated: And whatever other mantra-work is left over from the sacrifice, he obtains all that by this. In that he employs mantras preceded by Om,

original: āsarvamedhād ete kratava eta evāsya sarveṣu lokeṣu sarveṣu deveṣu sarveṣu vedeṣu
analyzed: ā sarvamedhāt ete kratavaḥ ete eva asya sarveṣu lokeṣu sarveṣu deveṣu sarveṣu vedeṣu
translated: from the Sarvamedha sacrifice onwards, these are his sacrifices. In all the worlds, in all the gods, in all the Vedas,

original: sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarveṣu sattveṣu kāmacāraḥ kāmavimocanaṃ bhavaty ardhe ca na pramīyate ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarveṣu sattveṣu kāmacāraḥ kāma vimocanam bhavati ardhe ca na pramīyate yaḥ evam veda
translated: in all the beings, in all the creatures, he has freedom to do as he wishes, and freedom from desire. And he is not harmed in the middle. He who knows this.

original: tad apy etad ṛcoktam /🔽āpo bhṛgvaṅgirorūpam āpo bhṛgvaṅgiromayam /
analyzed: tat api etat ṛcā uktam  āpaḥ bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ rūpam āpaḥ bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ mayam
translated: This is also said in the Ṛc:🔽The waters are the form of Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras, the waters are full of Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras.

original: sarvam āpomayaṃ bhūtaṃ sarvaṃ bhṛgvaṅgiromayam /
analyzed: sarvam āpaḥ mayam bhūtam sarvam bhṛgu aṅgiraḥ mayam
translated: All beings are full of water, all are full of Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras.

original: antaraite trayo vedā bhṛgūn aṅgiraso 'nugāḥ /
analyzed: antarā ete trayaḥ vedā bhṛgūn aṅgirasaḥ nugāḥ
translated: The three Vedas are contained within, with Bhṛgu and Aṅgiras following.

original: apāṃ puṣpaṃ mūrtir ākāśaṃ pavitram uttamam ity ācamyābhyukṣyātmānam anumantrayata indra jīveti brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: apām puṣpam mūrtiḥ ākāśam pavitram uttamam iti ācamya abhyukṣya ātmānam anumantrayate indra jīva iti brāhmaṇam
translated: The flower of the waters, the form, the pure sky, the best purifier. Having sipped and sprinkled himself, he should recite after the mantra: O Indra, live. The Brāhmaṇa continues.

original: Gopathabrāhmaṇa /
analyzed: gopathabrāhmaṇa
translated: The Gobhila Brāhmaṇa.

original: Pūrvabhāga /🔽Dvitīyaḥ prapāṭhakaḥ
analyzed: pūrvabhāga  dvitīyaḥ prapāṭhakaḥ
translated: The first part.🔽The second recitation.

original: oṃ brahmacārīṣṇaṃś carati rodasī ubhe ity ācāryam āha /
analyzed: om brahmacārīṣṇan carati rodasī ubhe iti ācāryam āha
translated: Om. The celibate one moves about in both the heaven and the earth. Thus he says to the teacher.

original: tasmin devāḥ sammanaso bhavantīti vāyum āha sa sadya eti pūrvasmād uttaraṃ samudram
analyzed: tasmin devāḥ sammanasaḥ bhavanti iti vāyum āha sa sadyas eti pūrvasmāt uttaram samudram
translated: In him the gods are of one mind, he says, referring to Vayu. He goes quickly from the eastern to the northern ocean.

original: ity ādityam āha dīkṣito dīrghaśmaśrur eṣa dīkṣita eṣa dīrghaśmaśrur eṣa evācāryasthāne
analyzed: iti ādityam āha dīkṣitaḥ dīrgha śmaśruḥ eṣa dīkṣitaḥ eṣa dīrgha śmaśruḥ eṣaḥ eva ācārya sthāne
translated: He says, referring to the sun. He is consecrated, with long beard. He is consecrated, with long beard. He stands in the place of the teacher.

original: tiṣṭhann ācārya iti stūyate vaidyutasthāne tiṣṭhan vāyur iti stūyate dyausthāne tiṣṭhann
analyzed: tiṣṭhan ācāryaḥ iti stūyate vaidyuta sthāne tiṣṭhan vāyuḥ iti stūyate dyau sthāne tiṣṭhan
translated: He is praised as the teacher. He stands in the place of lightning. He is praised as Vayu. He stands in the place of the sky.

original: āditya iti stūyate /
analyzed: ādityaḥ iti stūyate
translated: He is praised as the sun.

original: tad apy etad ṛcoktaṃ brahmacārīṣṇann iti brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: tat api etat ṛcā uktam brahmacārīṣṇan iti brāhmaṇam
translated: This is also stated in the Ṛg Veda verse: The celibate is radiant. The Brahmana text continues...

original: jāyamāno ha vai brāhmaṇaḥ saptendriyāṇy abhijāyante brahmavarcasaṃ ca yaśaś ca svapnaṃ ca krodhaṃ ca ślāghāṃ ca rūpaṃ ca puṇyam eva gandhaṃ
analyzed: jāyamānaḥ ha vai brāhmaṇaḥ sapta indriyāṇi abhijāyante brahmavarcasam ca yaśaḥ ca svapnam ca krodham ca ślāghām ca rūpam ca puṇyam eva gandham
translated: When a Brahmana is born, seven powers are born in him: spiritual radiance, fame, sleep, anger, boasting, beauty, and the auspicious smell

original: saptamam /
analyzed: saptamam
translated: as the seventh.

original: tāni ha vā asyaitāni brahmacaryam upetopakrāmanti mṛgān asya brahmavarcasaṃ gacchaty
analyzed: tāni ha vai asya etāni brahmacaryam upeta upakrāmanti mṛgān asya brahmavarcasam gacchati
translated: These seven powers come to him when he enters celibacy. His spiritual radiance goes to the deer,

original: ācāryaṃ yaśo 'jagaraṃ svapno varāhaṃ krodhopaślāghaṃ kumārīṃ rūpam oṣadhivanaspatīn
analyzed: ācāryam yaśaḥ jagaram svapnaḥ varāham krodha upaślāgham kumārīm rūpam oṣadhi vanaspatīn
translated: his fame to the teacher, his sleep to the python, his anger to the boar, his boasting to the young maiden, his beauty to the herbs and trees,🔽and his auspicious smell to the Brahmana.

original: puṇyo gandhaḥ sa yan mṛgājināni vaste tena tad brahmavarcasam avarundhe yad asya🔽mṛgeṣu bhavati saha snāto brahmavarcasī bhavati sa yad aharahar ācāryāya karmakarīti
analyzed: puṇyaḥ gandhaḥ sa yat mṛga ajināni vaste tena tat brahmavarcasam avarundhe yat asya  mṛgeṣu bhavati saha snātaḥ brahmavarcasī bhavati sa yat ahar ahar ācāryāya karmakarī iti
translated: The merit is the fragrance, by that he obtains the Brahmic glory which is in the deer;🔽when he has bathed together with him, he becomes glorious. The service which he does day by day to the teacher,

original: tena tad yaśo 'varundhe yad asyācārye bhavati saha snāto yaśasvī bhavati sa yat suṣupsur
analyzed: tena tat yaśaḥ varundhe yat asya ācārye bhavati saha snātaḥ yaśasvī bhavati sa yat suṣupsuḥ
translated: by that he obtains the fame which is in the teacher; when he has bathed together with him, he becomes famous. The sleep which he bestows

original: nidrānninayati tena taṃ svapnam avarundhe yo 'syājagare bhavati taṃ ha snātasvapantam
analyzed: nidrān ninayati tena tam svapnam avarundhe yaḥ sya ājagare bhavati tam ha snāta svapantam
translated: on him who is about to sleep, by that he obtains the dream which is in the python; they say to him who has bathed and is sleeping,

original: āhuḥ svapitum ainaṃ bobudhatheti sa kruddho vācā na kaṃcana hinasti puruṣāt puruṣāt
analyzed: āhuḥ svapitum ā enam bobudhatha iti sa kruddhaḥ vācā na kaṃcana hinasti puruṣāt puruṣāt
translated: Do not wake him, lest he should wake up. Angry, he does not injure anyone with his speech,

original: pāpīyān iva manyamānas tena taṃ krodham avarundhe yo 'sya varāhe bhavati tasya ha🔽snātasya krodhāślāghīyasaṃ viśante 'thādbhiḥ ślāghyamāno na snāyāt tena taṃ ślāghām
analyzed: pāpīyān iva manyamānaḥ tena tam krodham avarundhe yaḥ sya varāhe bhavati tasya ha  snātasya krodha aślāghīyasam viśante ślāghyamānaḥ na snāyāt tena tam ślāghām
translated: thinking that he is worse than any man; by that he obtains the anger which is in the boar; to him🔽who has bathed, the praise and the anger enter. Then, being praised with water, he should not bathe; by that he obtains the praise

original: avarundhe yāsyāpsu bhavati saha snātaḥ ślāghīyo 'nnebhyaḥ ślāghyo 'thaitad brahmacāriṇo
analyzed: avarundhe yā asya apsu bhavati saha snātaḥ ślāghīyaḥ nnebhyaḥ ślāghyaḥ u tha etat brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: which is in the water; when he has bathed together with it, he becomes more praiseworthy than those who eat food. Then this is the student's

original: rūpaṃ yat kumāryās tān nagnān nīdīkṣedetiveti mukhaṃ viparidhāpayet tena tad rūpam
analyzed: rūpam yat kumāryāḥ tān nagnān ni idīkṣet etivā iti mukham viparidhāpayet tena tat rūpam
translated: Whatever form there is in a maiden, he should look at them naked, and should make her turn her face away. By that

original: avarundhe yad asya kumāryāṃ bhavati taṃ ha snātaṃ kumārīm iva nirīkṣante 'thaid brahmacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: avarundhe yat asya kumāryām bhavati tam ha snātam kumārīm iva nirīkṣante brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: he obtains that form which is in her. Whatever there is in a maiden, they look at her as if she were bathed. Then these Brahmachārins

original: puṇyo gandho ya oṣadhivanaspatīnāṃ tāsāṃ puṇyaṃ gandhaṃ pracchidya nopajighret tena
analyzed: puṇyaḥ gandhaḥ yaḥ oṣadhi vanaspatīnām tāsām puṇyam gandham pracchidya na upajighret tena
translated: The auspicious smell of the herbs and trees, having cut off their auspicious smell, he should not smell them. By that

original: taṃ puṇyaṃ gandham avarundhe yo 'syauṣadhivanaspatīṣu bhavati sa ha snātaḥ puṇyagandhir🔽bhavati // / / //
analyzed: tam puṇyam gandham avarundhe yaḥ sya oṣadhi vanaspatīṣu bhavati sa ha snātaḥ puṇya gandhiḥ  bhavati
translated: he obtains that auspicious smell which is in the herbs and trees. He, having bathed, becomes fragrant with auspicious smell.

original: sa vā eṣa upayaṃś caturdhopaity agniṃ pādenācāryaṃ pādena grāmaṃ pādena mṛtyuṃ pādena
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ upayan caturdhā upaiti agnim pādena ācāryam pādena grāmam pādena mṛtyum pādena
translated: He, indeed, approaching in four ways approaches: with one foot the fire, with one foot the teacher, with one foot the village, with one foot death.

original: sa yad aharahaḥ samidha āhṛtya sāyaṃ prātar agniṃ paricaret tena taṃ pādam avarundhe
analyzed: sa yat ahar ahar samidhaḥ āhṛtya sāyam prātar agnim paricaret tena tam pādam avarundhe
translated: In that he should bring fuel day after day and should serve the fire morning and evening, by that he obtains that foot

original: yo 'syāgnau bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ sya agnau bhavati
translated: which is in his fire.

original: sa yad aharahar ācāryāya karma karoti tena taṃ pādam avarundhe yo 'sya ācārye bhavati /
analyzed: sa yat ahar ahar ācāryāya karma karoti tena tam pādam avarundhe yaḥ syaḥ ācārye bhavati
translated: In that he should do work for the teacher day after day, by that he obtains that foot which is in his teacher.

original: sa yad aharahar grāmaṃ praviśya bhikṣām eva parīpsati na maithunaṃ tena taṃ pādam🔽avarundhe yo 'sya grāme bhavati sa yat kruddho vācā na kaṃcana hinasti puruṣāt puruṣāt
analyzed: sa yat ahar ahar grāmam praviśya bhikṣām eva parīpsati na maithunam tena tam pādam  avarundhe yaḥ sya grāme bhavati sa yat kruddhaḥ vācā na kaṃcana hinasti puruṣāt puruṣāt
translated: When he, entering a village day after day, seeks alms only and not sexual intercourse, thereby he wins that quarter which is his in the village. When, being angry, he does not injure anyone with his speech, from man to man,🔽🔽

original: pāpīyāni manyamānas tenaiva taṃ pādam avarundhe yo 'sya mṛtyau bhavati // / / //
analyzed: pāpīyāni manyamānaḥ tena eva tam pādam avarundhe yaḥ sya mṛtyau bhavati
translated: In that he enters the village day after day and seeks alms only, not sexual intercourse, thereby he wins that quarter of his which is in the village. In that, being angry, he does not injure anyone with his speech, thinking that from man to man there is evil, thereby he wins that quarter of his which is in death.

original: pañca ha vā ete brahmacāriṇy agnayo dhīyante dvau pṛthagghastayor mukhe hṛdaya upastha eva pañcamaḥ /🔽sa yad dakṣiṇena pāṇinā striyaṃ na spṛśati tenāharahar yājināṃ lokam avarundhe yat
analyzed: pañca ha vai ete brahmacāriṇi agnayaḥ dhīyante dvau pṛthak hastayoḥ mukhe hṛdaye upasthe eva pañcamaḥ  sa yat dakṣiṇena pāṇinā striyam na spṛśati tena ahar ahar yājinām lokam avarundhe yat
translated: There are five Brahmachāri fires which are kept up: two in the separate hands, in the mouth, in the heart, and the fifth in the genitals.

original: savyena tena pravrājināṃ yan mukhena tenāgnipraskandināṃ yaddhṛdayena tena śūrāṇāṃ
analyzed: savyena tena pravrājinām yat mukhena tena agni praskandinām yat hṛdayena tena śūrāṇām
translated: In that he does not touch a woman with his right hand, thereby he wins day after day the world of the sacrificers. In that he does not with his left hand, thereby he wins the world of the hermits. In that he does not with his mouth, thereby he wins the world of those who have fallen into the fire. In that he does not with his heart, thereby he wins the world of the heroes.

original: yad upasthena tena gṛhamedhināṃ taiś cet striyaṃ parāharaty anagnir iva śiṣyate /
analyzed: yat upasthena tena gṛhamedhinām taiḥ ced striyam parāharati anagniḥ iva śiṣyate
translated: In that he does not with his genitals, thereby he wins the world of the householders. If he should have intercourse with a woman by those (organs), he remains as if without a fire.

original: sa yad aharahar ācāryāya kule 'nutiṣṭhate so 'nuṣṭhāya brūyād dharmagupto mā gopāyeti
analyzed: sa yat ahar ahar ācāryāya kule nutiṣṭhate saḥ nuṣṭhāya brūyāt dharma guptaḥ mā gopāya iti
translated: In that he attends day after day on the teacher's family, having attended he should say, 'Protect me, O guardian of the Law.'

original: dharmo hainaṃ gupto gopāyeti tasya ha prajā śvaḥ śvaḥ śreyasī śreyasī ha bhavati
analyzed: dharmaḥ ha enam guptaḥ gopāya iti tasya ha prajā śvas śvas śreyasī śreyasī ha bhavati
translated: 'The Dharma, when protected, will protect him,' they say. His offspring become better and better day by day.

original: dhāyyaiva pratidhīyate svarge loke pitṝn nidadhāti tāntavaṃ na vasīta yas tāntavaṃ
analyzed: dhāyyā eva pratidhīyate svarge loke pitṝn nidadhāti tāntavam na vasīta yaḥ tāntavam
translated: He is reborn in the heavenly world. He places his ancestors in heaven. One should not wear woolen garments.

original: vaste kṣatraṃ vardhate na brahma tasmāt tāntavaṃ na vasīta brahma vardhatāṃ mā kṣatram
analyzed: vaste kṣatram vardhate na brahma tasmāt tāntavam na vasīta brahma vardhatām mā kṣatram
translated: If one wears woolen garments, the Kshatriya prospers, not the Brahmana. Therefore one should not wear woolen garments. May the Brahmana prosper, not the Kshatriya.

original: iti nopary āsīta yad upary āste prāṇam eva tadātmane 'dharaṃ kurute yad vāto vahati
analyzed: iti na upari āsīta yat upari āste prāṇam eva tadā ātmane dharam kurute yat vātaḥ vahati
translated: One should not sit above (the teacher). If one sits above, one makes the breath subordinate to oneself. When the wind blows

original: adha evāsīta adhaḥ śayīta adhas tiṣṭhed adho vrajed evaṃ ha sma vaitat pūrve brāhmaṇā
analyzed: adhas eva āsīta adhas śayīta adhas tiṣṭhet adhas vrajet evam ha sma vā etat pūrve brāhmaṇā
translated: one should sit below, lie below, stand below, go below. Thus indeed did the Brahmanas of old

original: brahmacaryaṃ caranti taṃ ha sma tatputraṃ bhrātaraṃ vopatāpinam āhur upanayetainam
analyzed: brahmacaryam caranti tam ha sma tad putram bhrātaram vā upatāpinam āhuḥ upanayeta enam
translated: practice celibacy. They would say to the son or brother who was tormenting him, 'Let him initiate him.

original: ity āsamiddhārāt svareṣyanto 'nnam adyād athāha jaghanam āhuḥ snāpayetainam ity āsamiddhārān
analyzed: iti āsamidh hārān svar eṣyantaḥ annam adyāt atha āha jaghanam āhuḥ snāpayeta enam iti āsamidh hārān
translated: ' Thus, desiring to return home, he should eat food. Then they say, 'He should bathe.' Thus, desiring to return home,

original: na hy etāni vratāni bhavanti taṃ cecchayānam ācāryo 'bhivadet sa pratisaṃhāya pratiśṛṇuyāt
analyzed: na hi etāni vratāni bhavanti tam ced śayānam ācāryaḥ bhivadet sa pratisaṃhāya pratiśṛṇuyāt
translated: for these are not his observances. If the teacher should address him while he is lying down, he should reply after rising up.

original: taṃ cecchayānam upytāya taṃ ced utthitam abhiprakramya taṃ ced abhiprakrāntam abhipalāyamānam
analyzed: tam ced śayānam upytāya tam ced utthitam abhiprakramya tam ced abhiprakrāntam abhipalāyamānam
translated: If he is lying down, he should lie down; if he has risen, he should approach him; if he has approached, he should run away.

original: evaṃ ha sma vaitat pūrve brāhmaṇā brahmacaryaṃ caranti teṣāṃ ha sma vaiṣā puṇyā kīrtir
analyzed: evam ha sma vā etat pūrve brāhmaṇāḥ brahmacaryam caranti teṣām ha sma vā eṣā puṇyā kīrtiḥ
translated: Thus indeed did the ancient Brahmins practice celibacy. Their meritorious fame

original: gacchaty āha vā ayaṃ so 'dya gamiṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: gacchati āha vai ayam saḥ dya gamiṣyati iti
translated: goes forth, or one says, He will go today.

original: janamejayo ha vai pārīkṣito mṛgayāṃ cariṣyan haṃsābhyām aśikṣann upāvatastha iti
analyzed: janamejayaḥ ha vai pārīkṣitaḥ mṛgayām cariṣyan haṃsābhyām a śikṣan upāvatasthe iti
translated: Janamejaya, the son of Parikshit, while about to go hunting, stood waiting, having learned from two swans.

original: tāv ūcatur janamejayaṃ pārīkṣitam abhyājagāma sa hovāca namo vāṃ bhagavantau kau
analyzed: tau ūcatuḥ janamejayam pārīkṣitam abhyājagāma sa ha uvāca namaḥ vām bhagavantau kau
translated: They said to Janamejaya, the son of Parikshit, who approached them. He said, Salutations to you, Blessed Ones.

original: nu bhagavantāv iti tāv ūcatur dakṣiṇāgniś cāhavanīyaś ceti sa hovāca namo vāṃ bhagavantau
analyzed: nu bhagavantau iti tau ūcatuḥ dakṣiṇāgniḥ ca āhavanīyaḥ ca iti sa ha uvāca namaḥ vām bhagavantau
translated: Who are you, Blessed Ones? They said, The Dakshina fire and the Ahavaniya fire. He said, Salutations to you, Blessed Ones.

original: tadākīyatām iti hopārāmam ity api kila devā na ramante na hi devā na ramante 'pi
analyzed: iti ha upārāmam iti api kila devāḥ na ramante na hi devāḥ na ramante
translated: Let that be taught. Even the gods do not delight in a garden, he said. For the gods do not delight in a garden.

original: caikopārāmād devā ārāmam upasaṃkrāmantīti sa hovāca namo vāṃ bhagavantau kiṃ puṇyam
analyzed: ca eka upārāmāt devāḥ ārāmam upasaṃkrāmanti iti sa ha uvāca namaḥ vām bhagavantau kim puṇyam
translated: Even from a single garden, the gods go to a garden. He said, Salutations to you, Blessed Ones. What is meritorious?

original: iti brahmacaryam iti kiṃ laukyam iti brahmacaryam eveti tat ko veda iti dantāvalo
analyzed: iti brahmacaryam iti kim laukyam iti brahmacaryam eva iti tat kaḥ veda iti
translated: Thus is celibacy. What is worldly? Celibacy itself. Who knows that? Dantāvala

original: dhaumro 'tha khalu dantāvalo dhaumro yāvati tāvati kāle pārīkṣitaṃ janamejayam abhyājagāma
analyzed: dhaumraḥ tha khalu dantāvalaḥ dhaumraḥ yāvati tāvati kāle pārīkṣitam janamejayam abhyājagāma
translated: Dhaumra, indeed, Dantāvala-Dhaumra, in that time approached Janamejaya, the son of Parikṣit.

original: tasmā uptyāya svayam eva viṣṭaraṃ nidadhau tam upasaṃgṛhya papracchādhīhi bho kiṃ
analyzed: tasmai uptyāya svayam eva viṣṭaram nidadhau tam upasaṃgṛhya papraccha adhīhi bho kim
translated: Having approached him, he himself spread out a seat and, having approached him, asked, Teach, sir, what

original: puṇyam iti brahmacaryam iti kiṃ laukyam iti brahmacaryam eveti tasmā etat provācāṣṭācatvāriṃśad
analyzed: puṇyam iti brahmacaryam iti kim laukyam iti brahmacaryam eva iti tasmai etat provāca aṣṭācatvāriṃśat
translated: is meritorious? Celibacy, he said. What is worldly? Celibacy itself, he said. Therefore, he spoke this:

original: varṣaṃ sarvavedabrahmacaryaṃ tac caturdhā vedeṣu vyūhya dvādaśavarṣaṃ brahmacaryaṃ
analyzed: varṣam sarva veda brahmacaryam tat caturdhā vedeṣu vyūhya dvādaśa varṣam brahmacaryam
translated: Celibacy for forty-eight years, and that celibacy for all the Vedas is divided into four in the Vedas, celibacy for twelve years,

original: dvādaśavarṣāṇy avarārdham api stāyaṃś cared yathāśakty aparam /
analyzed: dvādaśa varṣāṇi avara ardham api stāyan caret yathāśakti aparam
translated: one should practice for at least twelve years, and the rest as one is able.

original: tasmā uhasy ṛṣabhau sahasraṃ dadāv apy apikīrtitam ācāryo brahmacārīty eka āhur ākāśam adhidaivatam athādhyātmaṃ brāhmaṇo vratavāṃś caraṇavān
analyzed: tasmai ṛṣabhau sahasram dadau api apikīrtitam ācāryaḥ brahmacārī iti eke āhuḥ ākāśam adhidaivatam atha adhyātmam brāhmaṇaḥ vratavān caraṇavān  /
translated: To him, he gave two thousand cows and a bull, and it is also said that the teacher is a celibate. Some say that the sky is the deity, and then in the self, a brahmin who observes vows, who practices,🔽a celibate...

original: brahmacārī // / / //
analyzed: brahmacārī

translated: In that the All-gods attended on him on the right side, he became the Sadasya. That is the Sadasyatva of the Sadasya.

original: manasaiva tāni sadasyo janad ity etāṃ vyāhṛtiṃ japaṃ cetyātmānaṃ janayati na jityātmānam🔽apitve dadhāti taṃ devā abruvan varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti vṛṇā iti sa varam avṛṇītāsyām eva
analyzed: manasā eva tāni sadasyaḥ janat iti etām vyāhṛtim japam cetya ātmānam janayati na jitya ātmānam  apitve dadhāti tam devāḥ abruvan varam vṛṇīṣva iti vṛṇai iti sa varam avṛṇīta asyām eva
translated: From the strength of this, the Sadasya is born. From the disease of the pen, they make a more abundant pen. The southern direction is terrible, the other directions are peaceful. Therefore, the Sadasya should murmur the Vyāhṛtis mentally, thinking Let me generate myself through the mind. He should not generate himself through the Jihvāmūlīya.

original: māṃ hotrāyām indrabhūtaṃ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭheyur iti taṃ tasyām eva
analyzed: mām hotrāyām indra bhūtam punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ iti tam tasyām eva
translated: He should place himself in the state of a guest. The gods said to him, Choose a boon. He said, I choose. He chose the boon, Let them stand in this very sacrifice, purifying, praising, and reciting me in the Hotṛ position, in the Indra-hood. They stood in this very sacrifice, purifying, praising, and reciting him in the Hotṛ position, in the Indra-hood.

original: hotrāyām indrabhūtaṃ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsanto 'tiṣṭhaṃs taṃ yat tasyām eva hotrāyām🔽indrabhūtaṃ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsantas tiṣṭhaṃs tad brāhmaṇāc
analyzed: hotrāyām indra bhūtam punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tam yat tasyām eva hotrāyām  indra bhūtam punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tat brāhmaṇāt
translated: They stood, purifying, praising, reciting, the Indra-essence in the Hotra. In that they stood, purifying, praising, reciting, the Indra-essence in that very Hotra,

original: chaṃsy abhavat tad brāhmaṇāc chaṃsinī brāhmaṇāc chaṃsitvaṃ saiṣaindrī hotrā yad brāhmaṇāc🔽chaṃsīyā dvitīyaṃ varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti vṛṇā iti sa varam avṛṇītāsyām eva māṃ hotrāyāṃ🔽vāyubhūtaṃ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsantas tiṣṭheyur iti taṃ tasyām eva hotrāyāṃ vāyubhūtaṃ
analyzed: chaṃsī abhavat tat brāhmaṇāt śaṃsinī brāhmaṇāt śaṃsi tvam sā eṣā aindrī hotrā yat brāhmaṇāt  chaṃsīyā dvitīyam varam vṛṇīṣva iti vṛṇai iti sa varam avṛṇīta asyām eva mām hotrāyām  vāyu bhūtam punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ iti tam tasyām eva hotrāyām vāyu bhūtam
translated: that became the Brahman-chanter. That is why the Brahman-chanter is so called. That is the Indra-like Hotra, namely the Brahman-chanter's.

original: punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsanto 'tiṣṭhaṃs taṃ yat tasyām eva hotrāyāṃ vāyubhūtaṃ punantastuvantaḥ
analyzed: punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tam yat tasyām eva hotrāyām vāyu bhūtam punantaḥ stuvantaḥ
translated: Choose a second boon,' he said. 'I choose,' he said. He chose this boon: 'May they stand, purifying, praising, reciting, the Vayu-essence in that very Hotra.' They stood, purifying, praising, reciting, the Vayu-essence in that very Hotra. In that they stood, purifying, praising, reciting, the Vayu-essence in that very Hotra,

original: śaṃsantas tiṣṭhaṃs tat potābhavat tat potuḥ potṛtvaṃ saiṣā vāyavyā hotrā yat potriyā
analyzed: śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tat potā abhavat tat potuḥ potṛ tvam sā eṣā vāyavyā hotrā yat potriyā
translated: that became the Potri. That is why the Potri is so called. That is the Vayu-like Hotra, namely the Potri's.

original: tṛtīyaṃ varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti vṛṇā iti sa varam avṛṇītāsyām eva māṃ hotrāyām agnibhūtam
analyzed: tṛtīyam varam vṛṇīṣva iti vṛṇai iti sa varam avṛṇīta asyām eva mām hotrāyām agni bhūtam
translated: Choose a third boon,' he said. 'I choose,' he said. He chose this boon: 'May they stand, purifying, praising, reciting, the Agni-essence in that very Hotra.'

original: indhānāḥ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsantas tiṣṭheyur iti taṃ tasyām eva hotrāyām agnibhūtam🔽indhānāḥ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsanto 'tiṣṭhaṃs taṃ yat tasyām eva hotrāyām agnibhūtam
analyzed: indhānāḥ punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ iti tam tasyām eva hotrāyām agni bhūtam  indhānāḥ punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tam yat tasyām eva hotrāyām agni bhūtam
translated: The kindlers, the purifiers, the praisers, the reciters, should stand, they said. Him, in that very offering, as Agni,🔽the kindlers, the purifiers, the praisers, the reciters, stood. Him, in that very offering, as Agni,

original: indhānāḥ punantastuvantaḥ śaṃsantas tiṣṭhaṃs tad āgnīdhro 'bhavat tad āgnīdhrasyāgnīdhratvaṃ
analyzed: indhānāḥ punantaḥ stuvantaḥ śaṃsantaḥ tiṣṭhan tat āgnīdhraḥ bhavat tat āgnīdhrasya āgnīdhra tvam
translated: the kindlers, the purifiers, the praisers, the reciters, stood. That became the Āgnīdhra (fire-altar). That is the Āgnīdhra's Āgnīdhra-ness.

original: saiṣāgneyī hotrā yad āgnīdhrīyeti brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: sā eṣā āgneyī hotrā yat āgnīdhrīyā iti brāhmaṇam
translated: That is the Agni-like offering, that is the Āgnīdhriya, says the Brāhmaṇa.

original: brāhmaṇo ha vā imam agniṃ vaiśvānaraṃ babhāra /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ha vai imam agnim vaiśvānaram babhāra
translated: The Brāhmaṇa indeed supported this Agni Vaiśvānara.

original: so 'yam agnir vaiśvānaro brāhmaṇena bhriyamāṇa imāṃl lokān janayate 'thāyam īkṣate
analyzed: saḥ yam agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ brāhmaṇena bhriyamāṇaḥ imān lokān janayate tha ayam īkṣate
translated: This Agni Vaiśvānara, supported by the Brāhmaṇa, generates these worlds. Then he considered:

original: 'gnir jātavedā brāhmaṇadvitīyo ha vā ayam idam agnir vaiśvānaro jvalati hantāhaṃ
analyzed: gniḥ jātavedāḥ brāhmaṇa dvitīyaḥ ha vai ayam idam agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ jvalati hantā aham
translated: Agni Jātavedas, having the Brāhmaṇa as his second, indeed burns this Agni Vaiśvānara. Let me

original: yan mayi teja indriyaṃ vīryaṃ tad darśayāmy uta vai mā bibhriyād iti sa ātmānam āpyāyayet
analyzed: yat mayi tejaḥ indriyam vīryam tat darśayāmi uta vai mā bibhriyāt iti saḥ ātmānam āpyāyayet
translated: show him whatever splendor, power, and strength are in me, and he will indeed support me. He should swell himself.

original: taṃ payo 'dhok tam imaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ darśayitvātmany ajuhot sa dvitīyam ātmānam āpyāyayet
analyzed: tam payaḥ dhok tam imam brāhmaṇam darśayitvā ātmani ajuhot sa dvitīyam ātmānam āpyāyayet
translated: They offered him as milk. Having shown him this Brāhmaṇa, he offered him into himself. He should swell himself a second time.

original: taṃ ghṛtam adhok tam imaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ darśayitvātmany ajuhot sa tṛtīyam ātmānam āpyāyayet
analyzed: tam ghṛtam adhok tam imam brāhmaṇam darśayitvā ātmani ajuhot sa tṛtīyam ātmānam āpyāyayet
translated: He offered that ghee, having shown this Brahman to himself. He would have satisfied his third self.

original: tad idaṃ viśvaṃ vikṛtam annādyam adhok tam imaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ darśayitvātmany ajuhot
analyzed: tat idam viśvam vikṛtam annādyam adhok tam imam brāhmaṇam darśayitvā ātmani ajuhot
translated: He offered that all this created food, having shown this Brahman to himself.

original: sa caturtham ātmānam āpyāyayet tena brāhmaṇasya jāyāṃ virājam apaśyat tām asmai prāyacchat
analyzed: sa caturtham ātmānam āpyāyayet tena brāhmaṇasya jāyām virājam apaśyat tām asmai prāyacchat
translated: He would have satisfied his fourth self. By that he saw the Brahman's wife Virāj. He gave her to him.

original: sa ātmā apitvam abhavat tata imam agniṃ vaiśvānaraṃ parāsyur brāhmaṇo 'gniṃ jātavedasam🔽adhatta so 'yam abravīt agne jātavedo 'bhinidhehi mehīti tasya dvaitaṃ nāmādhattāghoraṃ
analyzed: saḥ ātmā apitvam abhavat tatas imam agnim vaiśvānaram brāhmaṇaḥ gnim jātavedasam  adhatta saḥ yam abravīt agne jātavedaḥ bhinidhehi mā ihi iti tasya dvaitam nāma adhatta aghoram
translated: He became the self of that. From that they expelled this Agni Vaiśvānara. The Brahman put down Agni Jātavedas.

original: cākrūraṃ ca so 'śvo 'bhavat tasmād aśvo vaheta rathaṃ na bhavati pṛṣṭhena sādinaṃ
analyzed: ca akrūram ca saḥ u śvas bhavat tasmāt aśvaḥ vaheta ratham na bhavati pṛṣṭhena sādinam
translated: He said, O Agni Jātavedas, put me down. He gave him two names, Aghora and Ākṛūra. He became a horse. Therefore a horse should carry a chariot, not a rider on its back.

original: sa devān āgacchat sa devebhyo 'nvātiṣṭhat tasmād devā abibhayus taṃ brahmaṇe prāyacchat
analyzed: sa devān āgacchat sa devebhyaḥ nvā atiṣṭhat tasmāt devāḥ abibhayuḥ tam brahmaṇe prāyacchat
translated: He went to the gods. He attended on the gods. Therefore the gods were afraid. He gave him to the Brahman.

original: tam etayarcāśamayat // / / //
analyzed: tam etayā ṛcā aśamayat
translated: He appeased him with this verse.

original: agniṃ tv āhur vaiśvānaraṃ sadanān pradahanvagāḥ /
analyzed: agnim tu āhuḥ vaiśvānaram sadanān pradahan vagāḥ
translated: They call him Agni Vaiśvānara, who burns the seats of the wicked.

original: sa no devatrādhibrūhi māriṣām ā vayaṃ taveti /
analyzed: sa naḥ devatrā adhibrūhi māriṣām ā vayam tava iti
translated: Do thou, O Marisha, speak to the gods for us, that we may be thine.

original: tam etābhiḥ pañcabhir ṛgbhir upākurute yad akrandaḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāna iti /
analyzed: tam etābhiḥ pañcabhiḥ ṛgbhiḥ upākurute yat akrandaḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ iti
translated: He approaches him with these five verses, 'When thou didst cry out first being born' .

original: so 'śāmyat tasmād aśvaḥ paśūnāṃ jighatsur atamo bhavati vaiśvānaro hy eṣa tasmād
analyzed: saḥ śāmyat tasmāt aśvaḥ paśūnām jighatsuḥ atamaḥ bhavati vaiśvānaraḥ hi eṣa tasmāt
translated: He became appeased. Therefore the horse is the hungriest of animals. He is the dark one, for he is Vaiśvānara. Therefore

original: agniḥ padam aśvaṃ brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattaṃ tasya rasam apīḍayat sa raso
analyzed: agniḥ padam aśvam brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattam tasya rasam apīḍayat sa rasaḥ
translated: Agni gives the horse as a foot to the Brahman, for it was given to the Brahman. He pressed out its sap. That became the sap.

original: 'bhavad raso ha vā eṣa taṃ vā etaṃ rasaṃ santaṃ ratha ity ācakṣate parokṣeṇa parokṣapriyā
analyzed: bhavat rasaḥ ha vai eṣa tam vai etam rasam santam rathaḥ iti ācakṣate parokṣeṇa parokṣa priyā
translated: This is indeed that sap. They call it 'chariot' by a roundabout expression, for the gods love the roundabout,

original: iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: for the gods hate the direct.

original: sa devān āgacchat sa devebhyo 'nvātiṣṭhat tasmād devā abibhayus taṃ brahmaṇe prāyacchat tam etayarcājyāhutyābhyajuhod indrasyaujo marutām anīkam 🔽iti /
analyzed: sa devān āgacchat sa devebhyaḥ nvā atiṣṭhat tasmāt devāḥ abibhayuḥ tam brahmaṇe prāyacchat tam etayā ṛcā ājya āhutyā abhyajuhot indrasya ojaḥ marutām anīkam  / iti
translated: He went to the gods. He attended on the gods. Therefore the gods were afraid. He gave him to the Brahman. He offered him with this verse, the ghee offering, 'The vigour of Indra, the host of the Maruts' .

original: ratham abhihutvā tām etayarcātiṣṭhad vanaspate vīḍvaṅgo hi bhūyā iti /
analyzed: ratham abhihutvā tām etayā ṛcā atiṣṭhat vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ iti
translated: Having offered to the chariot, he mounted it with this verse, 'O tree, be firm-limbed' .

original: tasmād āgnyādheyikaṃ rathaṃ brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattaṃ tasya takṣāṇas tanūjyeṣṭhāṃ dakṣiṇāṃ niramimata /
analyzed: tasmāt āgnyādheyikam ratham brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattam tasya takṣāṇaḥ tanū jyeṣṭhām dakṣiṇām niramimata
translated: Therefore he gives the chariot belonging to the setting up of the sacred fires to the Brahman, for it is given to the Brahman. The carpenter made the Tanūjyā the sacrificial fee for it.

original: tāṃ pañcasv apaśyad ṛci yajuṣi sāmni śānte 'tha ghore /
analyzed: tām pañcasu apaśyat ṛci yajuṣi sāmni śānte tha ghore
translated: He saw it in five places, in the Ṛc, in the Yajuṣ, in the Sāman, in the Śānti, and in the Ghora.

original: tāsāṃ dve brahmaṇe prāyacchad vācaṃ ca jyotiś ca vāg vai dhenur jyotir hiraṇyaṃ tasmād
analyzed: tāsām dve brahmaṇe prāyacchat vācam ca jyotiḥ ca vāc vai dhenuḥ jyotiḥ hiraṇyam tasmāt
translated: Of these he gave two to the Brahman, speech and light. The cow is speech, the gold is light. Therefore

original: āgnyādheyikāṃ cātuṣprāśyāṃ dhenuṃ brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattā paśuṣu śāmyamāneṣu
analyzed: āgnyādheyikām cātuṣprāśyām dhenum brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattā paśuṣu śāmyamāneṣu
translated: he gives to the Brahman the cow to be eaten in four parts belonging to the setting up of the sacred fires, for it is given to the Brahman. When the cattle are being appeased

original: cakṣur hāpayanti cakṣur eva tadātmani dhatte yad vai cakṣus taddhiraṇyaṃ tasmād āgnyādheyikaṃ
analyzed: cakṣuḥ hāpayanti cakṣuḥ eva tat ātmani dhatte yat vai cakṣuḥ tat hiraṇyam tasmāt āgnyādheyikam
translated: he causes the eye to be lost. He puts the eye into himself. What the eye is, that is gold. Therefore he gives to the Brahman

original: hiraṇyaṃ brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattaṃ tasyātmann adhatta tena prājvalayad
analyzed: hiraṇyam brahmaṇe dadāti brahmaṇe hi prattam tasya ātman adhatta tena prājvalayat
translated: the gold belonging to the setting up of the sacred fires. It is given to the Brahman. He put it into himself. With it he kindled.

original: yan nādhatta tad āglābhavat tad āglā bhūtvā sā samudraṃ prāviśat sā samudram adahat
analyzed: yat na adhatta tat āglā abhavat tat āglā bhūtvā sā samudram prāviśat sā samudram adahat
translated: What he did not put in became the Āglava. Having become the Āglava, it entered the ocean. It burned the ocean.

original: tasmāt samudro durgir api vaiśvānareṇa hi dagdhaḥ sā pṛthivīm udait sā pṛthivīṃ vyadahat
analyzed: tasmāt samudraḥ durgiḥ api vaiśvānareṇa hi dagdhaḥ sā pṛthivīm udait sā pṛthivīm vyadahat
translated: Therefore the ocean is hard to cross, for it was indeed burned by Vaiśvānara. It rose up from the earth. It burned the earth.

original: sā devān āgacchat sā devān ahiḍat te devā brahmāṇam upādhāvan sa naivāgāyan nānṛtyat
analyzed: sā devān āgacchat sā devān ahiḍat te devāḥ brahmāṇam upādhāvan sa na eva agāyat na anṛtyat
translated: It went to the gods, it struck the gods. The gods ran up to the Brahman. He neither sang nor danced.

original: saiṣāglaiṣā kāruvidā nāma taṃ vā etam āglāhataṃ santam āglāgṛdha ity ācakṣate parokṣeṇa
analyzed: sā eṣā āglā eṣā kāruvidā nāma tam vai etam āglā hatam santam āglāgṛdhaḥ iti ācakṣate parokṣeṇa
translated: That is the Agla, that is the Karuvida. Him, being the Aglahat, they call the Aglagridha by a roundabout expression.

original: parokṣapriyā iva hi devā bhavanti pratyakṣadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ bhavanti pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love the roundabout, as it were, and hate the direct.

original: ya eṣa brāhmaṇo gāyano vā nartano vā bhavati tam āglāgṛdha ity ācakṣate tasmād brāhmaṇo
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ gāyanaḥ vā nartanaḥ vā bhavati tam āglāgṛdhaḥ iti ācakṣate tasmāt brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The Brahman who is either a singer or a dancer, him they call the Aglagridha. Therefore the Brahman

original: naiva gāyen nānṛtyen māglāgṛdhaḥ syāt tasmād brāhmyaṃ pūrvaṃ havir aparaṃ prājāpatyaṃ prājāpatyāt brāhmaṇam evottamam iti brāhmaṇam // / /
analyzed: na eva gāyet na a nṛtyet mā āglāgṛdhaḥ syāt tasmāt brāhmyam pūrvam haviḥ aparam prājāpatyam prājāpatyāt brāhmaṇam eva uttamam iti brāhmaṇam
translated: should neither sing nor dance, lest he become an Aglagridha. Therefore the Brahman offering is first, the Prajapati offering is later. From the Prajapati offering the Brahman is the highest. Thus says the Brahmana.

original: atharvāṇaś ca ha vā āṅgirasaś ca bhṛgucakṣuṣī tad brahmābhivyapaśyaṃs tad ajānan vayaṃ vā idaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhṛgvaṅgirasa iti /
analyzed: atharvāṇaḥ ca ha vai āṅgirasaḥ ca bhṛgu cakṣuṣī tat brahma abhivyapaśyan tat ajānan vayam vai idam sarvam yat bhṛgu aṅgirasaḥ iti
translated: And Atharvan and Angiras saw with the eye of Bhrigu that Brahman. They knew it, We are indeed all this which is the Bhrigus and Angiras.

original: te devā brāhmyaṃ havir yat sāṃtapane 'gnāv ajuhavur etad vai brāhmyaṃ havir yat sāṃtapane
analyzed: te devāḥ brāhmyam haviḥ yat sāṃtapane gnau ajuhavuḥ etat vai brāhmyam haviḥ yat sāṃtapane
translated: The gods offered that Brahman offering in the fire of Santarpana. That indeed is the Brahman offering which is in the fire of Santarpana.

original: 'gnau hūyate eṣa ha vai sāṃtapano 'gnir yad brāhmaṇas tasyorjayorjāṃ devā abhajanta
analyzed: gnau hūyate eṣa ha vai sāṃtapanaḥ gniḥ yat brāhmaṇaḥ tasya ūrjayā ūrjām devāḥ abhajanta
translated: He is offered in the fire. Verily, this Brāhmaṇa is the fire that refreshes. The gods shared the strength of that strength with him.

original: sumanasa eva svadhāṃ pitaraḥ śraddhayā svargaṃ lokaṃ brāhmaṇās tena sunvanty ṛṣayo
analyzed: sumanasaḥ eva svadhām pitaraḥ śraddhayā svargam lokam brāhmaṇāḥ tena sunvanti ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The Pitṛs with faith their own portion. The Brāhmaṇas with faith heaven. By that the Ṛṣis

original: 'ntataḥ striyaḥ kevala ātmany avārundhata vāhyā ubhayena sunvanti yad vai yajñe brāhmyaṃ
analyzed: striyaḥ kevale ātmani avārundhata vāhyāḥ ubhayena sunvanti yat vai yajñe brāhmyam
translated: press. The women at the end only in themselves. The outsiders with both. What is the sacrificial offering to Brahman

original: havir na nirūpyetānṛjavaḥ prājāpatyahaviṣo manuṣyā jāyerann asau yāṃl lokān śṛṇv
analyzed: haviḥ na nirūpyeta anṛjavaḥ prājāpatya haviṣaḥ manuṣyāḥ jāyeran asau yān lokān śṛṇu
translated: if it is not set out, men would be born with crooked sacrificial offerings to Prajāpati. Those worlds which you hear

original: iti pitā hy eṣa āhavanīyasya gārhapatyasya dakṣiṇāgner yo 'gnihotraṃ juhotīti vā
analyzed: iti pitā hi eṣaḥ āhavanīyasya gārhapatyasya dakṣiṇāgneḥ yaḥ gnihotram juhoti iti vā
translated: are the father of the Āhavanīya, the Garhapatya, and the Dakṣiṇāgni. He who offers the Agnihotra,

original: priye dhāmani madanti teṣām eṣo 'gniḥ sāṃtapanaśreṣṭho bhavaty etasya vāci tṛptāyām

translated: Of them Indra stole the Ucchāna Sāmans. He gave them to the Hotṛ. The Ajya (Sāman) indeed belonged to the Hotṛ.

original: praugaṃ potur vaiśvadevaṃ ha vai hotur babhūva niṣkevalyaṃ neṣṭur marutvatīyaṃ ha
analyzed: praugam potuḥ vaiśvadevam ha vai hotuḥ babhūva niṣkevalyam neṣṭuḥ marutvatīyam ha
translated: The Prāuga belonged to the Potṛ. The Vaiśvadeva indeed belonged to the Hotṛ. The Niṣkevalya belonged to the Neṣṭṛ. The Marutvatīya indeed belonged to the Hotṛ.

original: vai hotur babhūva āgnimārutam āgnīdhrasya tasmād etad abhyastataram iva śasyate yad
analyzed: vai hotuḥ babhūva āgnimārutam āgnīdhrasya tasmāt etat abhyastataram iva śasyate yat

analyzed: āgnimārutam yasmāt ete saṃśaṃsukāḥ iva bhavanti yat hotā potā neṣṭā āgnīdhraḥ mumohe
translated: because these (priests) are as if contending with each other. If the Hotṛ, Potṛ, Neṣṭṛ, or Āgnīdhra should forget,

analyzed: vasīta tat brahmā iyasām iva āsa tāsām ardham pratilulopa prathama arhaṇam ca prathama padam
translated: he should recite that (Sāman). That is as if the Brahman (priest) of them. Of them he stole half and the first invocation and the first word,

original: caitad dakṣiṇāṃ caitat pariśiṣeded iti brāhmaṇam // / / //
analyzed: ca etat dakṣiṇām ca etat pariśiṣedet iti brāhmaṇam
translated: This is the southern (altar), and this he leaves over for the Dakshina (altar). Thus says the Brâhmana.

original: uddālako ha vā āruṇir udīcyān vṛto dhāvayāṃcakāra tasya ha niṣka upāhito babhūva
analyzed: uddālakaḥ ha vai āruṇiḥ udīcyān vṛtaḥ dhāvayāṃcakāra tasya ha niṣkaḥ upāhitaḥ babhūva
translated: Uddalaka Âruni was employed by the people of the north to officiate for them. A Nishka was offered to him,

original: upavādād bibhyato yo mā brāhmaṇo 'nūcāna upavadiṣyati tasmā etaṃ pradāsyāmīti taddhodīcyān
analyzed: upavādāt bibhyataḥ yaḥ mā brāhmaṇaḥ nūcānaḥ upavadiṣyati tasmai etam pradāsyāmi iti tat ha udīcyān
translated: (saying), 'I will give it to that Brâhman who will instruct me.' The people of the north were afraid of the reproach (which would attach to them if they did not give the Nishka to Uddalaka).

original: brāhmaṇān bhayaṃ bibheda uddālako ha vā ayam āyāti kaurupāñcālī brahmā brahmaputraḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhayam bibheda uddālakaḥ ha vai ayam āyāti kauru pāñcālī brahmā brahma putraḥ
translated: 'Uddalaka is coming,' they said, 'the son of Kauraupâyanchî, the Brahman, the son of a Brahman.

original: sa ūrdhvaṃ vṛto na paryādadhīta kenemaṃ vīreṇa prati saṃyatāmahā iti taṃ yata eva
analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvam vṛtaḥ na paryādadhīta kena imam vīreṇa prati saṃyatāmahai iti tam yatas eva
translated: He is employed (to officiate) for us, and will not give up his office. By what hero shall we meet him?' They went to him wherever he had gone,

original: prapannaṃ dadhre tata evam anupratipedire taṃ ha svaidāyanaṃ śaunakam ūcuḥ svaidāyana
analyzed: prapannam dadhre tatas evam anupratipedire tam ha svaidāyanam śaunakam ūcuḥ svaidāyana
translated: and he went to them wherever they were. They said to Svaidâyana Shaunaka, 'Svaidâyana,

original: tvaṃ vai no brahmiṣṭho 'sīti tvayemaṃ vīreṇa pratisayatāmahā iti taṃ yata eva prapannaṃ
analyzed: tvam vai naḥ brahmiṣṭhaḥ sīti tvayā imam vīreṇa iti tam yatas eva prapannam
translated: you are the most learned in sacred writ among us. By what hero shall we meet him?' They went to him wherever he had gone,

original: dadhre tata evam anupratipedire taṃ ha svaidāyanā ity āmantrayāmāsa sa ho gotamasya
analyzed: dadhre tatas evam anupratipedire tam ha svaidāyanāḥ iti āmantrayāmāsa sa ho gotamasya
translated: and he went to them wherever they were. They addressed him, saying, 'Svaidâyana.'🔽'Yes,' he said.

original: putretīti hāsmā asūyāt pratiśrutaṃ pratiśuśrāva sa vai gautamasya putra ūrdhvaṃ vṛto
analyzed: putra iti iti ha asmai asūyāt pratiśrutam pratiśuśrāva sa vai gautamasya putraḥ ūrdhvam vṛtaḥ
translated: He said, Son! and he envied him. He listened to the promise. He, the son of Gautama, was chosen above.

original: 'dhāvīt // / / //
analyzed: dhāvīt
translated: He ran away.
